description:
Great service and great food.  Had the combination chow mein which was cooked perfectly.  The noodles were thick & chewy and the combination of meat (pork, beef & chicken) were excellent.

If you're in town, give a try!
author: Dan G.

description:
We stopped through here as a part of touring the city. The food was pretty good, but nothing outstanding. We got some calamari, dim sum, and lamb skewers. 

The free green tea ice cream after was good and welcome after walking all day.
author: Ian V.

description:
I truly wish I could say there were redeeming factors to this restaurant, but I would STRONGLY recommend you avoid this restaurant if you can avoid it. 

I spent about 1 hour, 10 minutes in the restaurant, 40 minutes of that was waiting for my glass of still water (the iced tea actually showed up at the table 2 minutes before my water, the simplest of drinks). If waiting over half an hour (and through 2 servers and 1 runner) isn't enough, we ordered the lunch special, which is 2 entrees, a smaller serving of dim sum, and green tea ice cream for dessert, and by the time we left, we still had not received part of our meal and our ice cream. 

When the check was delivered (by the runner, not our server or the other server we had), I tried to explain that we were missing part of our meal and this was unacceptable. He could not seem to understand, grabbed a third female server, said something in another language to her while glaring at me, and then stormed away (with our ice cream in hand, by the way, which he never returned with). 

I then had to explain to the server multiple times that we never received part of our meal, that I did not want it to go, and that I wanted it removed from the check. We ended up paying her (in cash) the price minus the missing food. I would recommend paying in cash if you can, card transactions are hit or miss apparently, and the place is so unhelpful when you're there I can only imagine the headache it would be to dispute a double charge. 

What drew us to this restaurant was an advertisement for free potsticker dim sum and free green tea ice cream, neither of which we received. This was a horrible experience.
author: Chris D.

description:
Please, try to avoid this place. 
First, it was a person on the street trying to get you in the restaurant.  Second, the service wasn't good at all. The Lemon  chicken was too sweet. It was like eating pure  sugar.
author: Ari H.

description: This restaurant has been around for a long time.  The people there are truly kind hearted people.  They are not your fast, shuffle in and shuffle out place or some "new wave" that's here one day and gone the next.  This place is more of like the original chinatown places that have been there since years past.  It has that Chinese feel.  If you know what to order, it is pretty good.  I'm not sure what people are looking for when they go to a restaurant in chinatown.  Some people looking for something cheap and quick but then complain it's cheap.  Some people look for that authentic feel with the traditional decor but complain it's old.  I suggest taking a moment and just enjoy the place, ask for specialties and tell them what you like and don't like and see what you can find.  It may surprise you.
author: Food Is L.

description:
This is disgusting filthy and exists purely as a tourist trap - the food is fatty tasteless and looks nothing like real Chinese cuisine I wish I could give it 0 stars 

They have an army of people outside to drag tourists in - please do yourself a favor and eat elsewhere
author: Marcus B.

description: Great place for large parties. Our whole team of 8 fit at one table. The food was good and delicious. Very happy with the service!!
author: Bonnie L.

description:
Don't go In
And if your that desperate 
Check your bill
I was forced a $25 tip 
Service was not good 
Food was a score of 4 on a scale of 1-10
And they also tried to charge me for something I didn't get 
And be careful on your bill too as when you hand that card over they Rey to get you to make another tip. 
It's not going to the server but the house 
Not worth it
author: Cassandra Sandy A.

description: Worst service ever!!!! They were charging me for stuff I didn't even get. They wanted 26$ tip and got mad when I said I wouldn't give them a tip because the service was terrible. Not only did they not want to adjust our bill but the waitress accused of lying and saying she did bring us the stuff they were charging us for. Don't waste your time on this place.
author: Koko H.

description: I apologize, but we had a very poor experience here. Our friends were enticed by the coupons being passed out for free ice cream with the meal, and so we ventured in for lunch. The service took a very long time, and we ended up spending a good chunk of time waiting for our food. In addition, we were billed for items we never ordered, and they tried to insist that the bill was correct before finally understanding their error. Apparently they also put the tip on the bill, but it was inconsistent amongst us (we split the check). Overall it was very confusing and stressful. Definitely not worth the wait and confusion. The food wasn't anything to write home about, either.
author: Sierra G.

description: I went here to pick up my mealpal at noon and there was literally nobody inside. There were no staff at the front desk, literally no guests inside either. It was the strangest thing - I waited about 10 minutes before leaving after receiving no service. It was the most bizarre place I've been that calls itself a restaurant. Is this some weird joke of a building?
author: Julius S.

description: The worst dining experience I have ever had. The food was not very tasty and made me feel sick later. Be sure to review bill carefully as they will try and add more to the bill and they assume a tip. I would not recommend this place at all!
author: Lindy M.

description:
People are really hating on this place but I loved it. Ordered chicken potstickers. Beef lettuce wraps, and Shanghai pork dumplings. Everything was hot and tasty. I was completely satisfied and the service is above average for an Asian restaurant. Weird that so many people had such a bad experience...

As for the automatically added tip- at the bottom of the menu it clearly says that 18% gratuity is added to parties of 5 or more. This is common practice in many sit down restaurants and shouldn't come as a surprise
author: Anne G.

description:
The food was decent so I won't give the place only one star. The service on the other hand was horrendous. The staff didn't greet us, nobody smiled, and the overall vibe felt very unwelcoming. After we were seated, it took a long time before our order was taken and our food was brought out. They were quick to bring our check though. Everything is overpriced but we knew that already when we saw the menu. 

Don't be fooled by the people on the street corner handing out flyers. They're very friendly so I assumed the same about the restaurant staff. I was wrong.
author: Bernard L.

description:
They literally drag you in of the street and are really sweet and friendly until they get you upstairs.  Barely had sat down and was being asked what we wanted to order.  I asked for some hot tea and time to look at the menu.
Very high pressure and argumentative... We felt highly uncomfortable and eventually walked out.
author: Sloan L.

description: Food was okay, service was horrible. Rude waitress and lengthy wait for drinks and food. Perhaps they need more help?
author: Mindy W.

description:
This place isn't all that horrible as everyone says if you can overlook the service and extra cost for certain things. If you read others reviews the complaints are mainly from service and the added gratuity of 18% that you're charged with your meal no matter the size of your party. We had a party of 8 so it didn't matter to us. It's also $1.50 for a bowl of rice. And if you want tea, there's a charge per person. This place is an Asian restaurant and it is in Chinatown (even named Chinatown restaurant) how can you really expect great/good service. Asian restaurants have a reputation of having bad service, unless you're at a real fancy one. 

The food wasn't so bad. Spicy wonton was good, small little pieces of pork filled wontons. Mongolian beef was flavored very well. Spicy eggplant was okay. Fish boiled in spicy sauce I hoped to taste more of that Szechuan spice, it was decent. Chow fun was good. And some kind of chicken and shrimp (forgot what they were called) was good as well. Nothing tasted bad. Everything was decent and there were a few dishes that were better than I expected. Definitely on the pricier side though. 

At the end of your meal you get complimentary green tea ice cream. Good thing also is that they validate your parking ticket for the parking structure right down the street.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Writing this review as our party of 5 waits.  Service is terrible.  They have more people on the streets handing out flyers than they have in the restaurant serving. Took 15 minutes to have our order taken and another 15 to get the order to our table.  The food at Panda Express is better than this place, and I consider Panda Express to be the Taco Bell of Chinese food. Very pricey for what you get.

Addendum: I read another yelp review of this place that commented about them automatically adding a tip to the bill.  When our bill arrived, there it was, 18%.  I asked them to present me with a bill without a tip and that I would add what I thought was appropriate.  She showed me a menu, pointing out the princ on the bottom that stated, "An 18% tip may be added to orders of parties 5 or greater".  I pointed out to her the operative word "may"  and explained that it did not say "will" and asked her if she thought the service of her and her staff was worth 18%.  No answer.  She came back with our CC receipt and asked for 5%.  I said, "No", zeroed out the tip line, signed it and walked.  She definitely has a giant set of brass ones.
author: Eric M.

description:
Relatively pricey for the portions, but I think you know that by looking at the menu, so I won't comment on that further.

Pretty good food!

I'd say the staff were friendly, but my party was full of Chinese speakers, so it may vary with pure English usage. It was pretty funny watching my aunts struggle with how to eat a fortune cookie!
author: Charley C.

description:
Very expensive. Tip is automatically added. Be aware of double tipping!
They automatically add 20% tip, which is very deceptive since the credit card bill has a tip line as well.
author: Jaz S.

description: Horrible service, mediocre food, and over priced. Luring people in with coupons, but can't handle the lunch rush once it comes, and forgetting about the customers who were there prior to rush of people. Denied outside seating for 3, stating tables are only for 2. Immediately after rejecting us, letting a group of 5 sit outside. Do not go here!
author: Anni G.

description:
I've been here a few times when i was younger and overall the place hasnt changed much. I was happy to bring my mom back here after walking through the city all day.
There are lots of seating available on the top floor. Bigger closed off rooms are around for VIP parties and there is open seating outside on the balcony of the building if you want a view of Chinatown below. Cute succelents are all over near the windows with traditional photos of the restaurant history throughout the dining area. The waiters were all well dressed in the red new year vests/jackets.
Also, WiFi and Restrooms are available here!!!

For the food, we got the Peking Duck, egg tart and taro puffs. They tasted absolutely wonderful to my taste buds after all that walking. Everything was fresh, and perfect for two.
For the wraps that came with the duck, I thought they'd be a little thicker or would be more of the traditional coconut bun shape, but otherwise it was all worth it. Paid a total of $72, including tip, and topped it all with the free dumpling and ice cream discount we picked up in Chinatown before we got there. 

Much satisfied!!!
author: Kat W.

description:
I'm not really understanding the negative reviews about this place. I go to Chinatown all the time in New York and learned the poor ratings come from people who don't understand the Chinatown experience. 

My friend and I were very hungry and wanted some dim sum. We walked past this place randomly, didn't even look it up in advance, enjoyed the meal very much so I'm actually quite shocked to see the ratings after my experience there.

We did the dim sum sampler for two and it was great. Service was a tad slow but the food was very good and plentiful for the price tag. We left full and happy, without paying much for it! My favorites were the bacon-wrapped shrimp and the sesame balls. Also, I never like green tea ice cream, but whatever they gave us was so so so good!

Be cautious, they already include tip when they give you the bill!
author: Jackie S.

description: DO NOT GO HERE!!!!! I wish I could give it 0 stars. The food came out late and cold. Tip was included in the bill for 2 PEOPLE. Their coupon sucks ass because you have to buy an expensive entree to only receive ONE free potsticker haha. Also they falsely advertised on a menu that they validate parking with purchase but they don't include the minimum that you have to spend ($50+). The waitress that served us was so rude when I asked about more information about the coupon and parking validation. Overall, only go here is you want to be disappointed.
author: Roxane R.

description:
Did someone mention this restaurant as a " tourist trap "!! It certainly is. Having lived in the neighborhood for over 3 years, I have tried almost all the restaurants in Chinatown but never been here. This was my first and will be the last one. The food arrived wayyyyy late!!Combination fried rice was served cold.. probably it was sitting  in the kitchen for over 5 minutes or so. Ordered lamb skewer aptzr and was served cumin lamb! This could be forgiven given the waitress was running around all over taking orders at the same time! They substituted the aptzr but I just couldn't take more than a bite to lamb!! Tan-tan noodle~ oh well it was just tanned with oil!!
And yeah! With 45 dollar chq they pre-added Tips and the total came almost 54 dollars!! I left 50 dollars and left!!  I just hate giving negative reviews, but some places definitively deserve these reviews!!
author: N B.

description: Food is decent, over priced for quantity/ plus TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!!! Waitress was on her phone the whole time she took our order and didn't make eye contact once. I had ordered pot stickers but they didn't come out. Our food came out and still no pot stickers. No one asked if we wanted refills for our drinks. Just a sad excuse for a restaurant. Asked 3 different waitresses and still no pot stickers! Ordered one entree and rice which should be around $17 but bill stated $30 when asked they said oh sorry then changed the price back to the original which they tried to scam us. Don't come here if you want good customer service!
author: Russel R.

description: stay away frm this joint. they charge you tips without your permission!!!!! food is not that good. thieves!!!!!! 1st and last time!!!!
author: I M.

description: Totally legit Chinese Restaurant. Had Mongolian beef with brown rice, potstickers, shrimp dim sum, chicken dim sum, and pork sticky buns. All yummy. Authentic Chinese since 1919. We were enticed by the street team then lead upstairs to our table. Fun experience! A must! Green Tea Ice Cream really good too!
author: Donna L.

description: I ate an iron in the plate! The health condition is worried me. And you need to wait really long until the service. The flavor is so so. Maybe Americans likes this flavor but I haven't seen any chinese here.
author: Wenmin X.

description: Worst Chinese food for a high price! We ordered their house specialty fish for $20. We got the most bean sprouts and little fish! We also ordered a sizzling beef, but it was pretty cold. We asked the waitress to reheat it but she was trying to arugula it was hot and reluctant to do it! Don't ever come back here
author: Cathy L.

description: None of the items my table ordered swooned me over to create an impression that would make this place to recommend to others. They have a complementary Pot stickers tastes horrible. Also I was surprised to see 20% tip added to the bill with no choice. We were party of 3 and service isn't that good. If you are not giving an option for getting your tip probably you should have the place clean and improve your service.
author: Jayakanthan D.

description: They got us in by free potstickers. The food was pretty good! It was a little pricey, but you are in the heart of Chinatown! The waitress was a little hard to communicate with, but we got all our food quickly and fresh!
author: Betsy M.

description: What a pleasant surprise it was to run into this amazing little Chinatown Restaurant  called just that, Chinatown Restaurant! We sat in the balcony and had a great view and lunch! The server was friendly and helpful. The area is charming like a scene out of an old Chinese American movie. It was a great experience and I highly recommend it!
author: Karlos G.

description: The food was good and the venue is interesting. The quality of ingredients wasn't too high but the major pain was the AUTOMATIC gratuity they apply. It was just two of us so you'd think the gratuity would be outlined since it's not customary to have gratuities included on all parties, just large ones. They didn't bring us water, check on how we were or bring us the check (until we asked). I have no problem with tips when they are earned but this honestly just felt like a ripoff.
author: Katie M.

description: Hungry?? DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!! Stay away! I agree with the other recent reviews and they were so right! Wish we saw the reviews before going in. They are all correct. We were a party of 11 people- moms and young ladies needing a quick bite to eat. The lady took our orders and we asked for waters for the entire table. 20 mins later... Hmmmm.... where is our water? I had to personally get up and ask for the waters again and again. Food good, but NOT worth the up charge for a big party. They DID NOT deserve any tip at all. Their customer service is VERY poor. After we tried to figure out the check and started to walk away - the waitress yelled out "Shame to you all". REALLY??? Shame on Chinatown Restaurant for your poor poor poor poor poor very poor customer service. Like the others said- they TRULY left a bad taste in our mouths. Shame on them!!!!!
author: Jocelyn A.

description: Are you a tourist or just a regular person looking for a meal well don't go here! It's definitely a place with bad communication/ bad quality of service. Most of all WATCH YOUR BILL --SCAM, They already add additional $5.00 on to what you bought if you ask why they say it's a tip then there's a section to add a tip from the ACTUAL RECEIPT- Basically adding money to your bill. 2nd quality of food just not worth the price it's basic rice/ over priced food. Also never use the red menu use the black menu. Red is what they use to overcharge on food items..Nahhh just don't go here. Also saw cockroaches maybe I'll call the health inspector to visit them. You're welcome theres thousands Chinese food places in Chinatown this just isn't a good one.
author: Rock H.

description: We were confronted by a lady on the street for this restaurant. We were very hungry.  So we went in. It was ok..there are so many place to choose from.  Good luck
author: Felipe A.

description: Got lured in with a coupon on the street. Yes, this is a tourist trap but not horrible. 18.95 a person for dim sum sampler. Husband was still hungry. The skewer was tough but the dim sum good. I probably wouldn't recommend unless you are near by and hungry.  Also, downstairs bathroom smelled like sewer.
author: Leslie Z.

description: My family and I were excited to try dimsum but the restaurant we were going to go to try stopped serving the dimsum menu by dinner. There were women handing out flyers on the corner that gave free potstickers and green tea ice cream at this place. We decided, why not let's give it a try. The food was pretty average, nothing too exciting. The BBQ pork buns were probably the best thing we ordered but too expensive for just 3 buns. Service was pretty slow and everyone in the restaurant were tourists like ourselves. The spring rolls were greasy and the crystal chicken dumplings were pretty awful. Not the worst place we could have gone but definitely better.
author: Jena H.

description: By far the worst Chinese restaurant ever at san fransisco. If craving for a hot pot, don't get it from their menu. The price is expensive, with bad service. Not only that they charged my card twice!!!. Called them back and they said "sorry can't help you". If you are looking for a Chinese restaurant to eat at. DO NOT eat at this one unless you want to get ripped off
author: Jonathan S.

description: Do not listen to these other reviews!! The food was so good! I loved every single thing that we ordered. One of the best things we got was the fried rice. This restaurant also allows dogs, if you care about that kind of stuff. Also the service was very fast and we got our food almost instantly after we order. I don't agree with the ratings for this place (2 Stars right now) because overall this was great food. I am only in town for five days and we have eaten there twice already.
author: Emma B.

description:
in San Francisco for our anniversary. while walking through Chinatown looking for lunch a woman handed us a flyer for a lunch combo. we took the flyer and walked around but ended up back here. so glad we did, everything was phenomenal. we walked up and down the street, nothing else looked very appealing. 
the restaurant is on the second floor, it's bright and open. not super fancy but nice and casual. I especially liked the pictures of old San Francisco and the asian influences, it was very charming. the tea was like a thai tea, creamy, with a deep flavor. I've never seen lemon chicken on a menu before, only orange. I was worried it would be too sour for my boyfriend but it ended up tasting like a glazed donut or something. I love sweet and savory, it had a good amount of chicken, not too much breading. the fried rice was well seasoned and fresh. I dont know what they are putting in the sweet and sour but I wish they would bottle it, we were throwing it on everything. it was so good. though everything was delicious, better still, the combo came with the best green tea ice cream that i have ever had. the deal was also a nice treat. I know for sure we will be coming back.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Review as of 11/23/2017 Not Sure why so many poor reviews. I ordered the Sweet & Chicken & my so ordered the BBQ Pork Buns. Out on the street they are passing out a coupon for free pot stickers & green tea ice cream. The food was good and worth coming back.
author: Robert B.

description: No this place is not for to go food was nasty sauce was rather to go Panda Express is wat better than this shit
author: Sunny K.

description: Beware SCAM!!!  They have people on the corners handing out "coupons" and nearly forcing you into their restaurant!  If your reading this and haven't been forced in then keep on walking, don't make eye contact and whatever you do, DO NOT EAT HERE!  We ordered 2 appetizers thinking one would be free from the coupon.  Well the coupon doesn't say free order it states "free potstickers".  You get 4 extra pot stickers!  They asked if we wanted fried rice with our entrees.  Normally included at ever other Chinese restaurant.  Not here, $9.95 for a small plate that didn't even serve the 3 of us.  Bill comes and there is an 18% gratuity added at the bottom!  Menu states parties of 5 or more get that added!  Needless to say I paid with my Discover card and they will be getting a nice charge back from them on my behalf!  Shadiest place we've been to!  Beware!  You've been warned!
author: Kirk S.

description: Service and food was amazing!!!!!! Wait time to be seated was under a few minutes. Plates came out hot and ready to eat!! The family and I are definitely coming back.
author: Vincent H.

description: Was given a brochure to eat, food was very small portions, not very tasty, and overpriced.   Definitely not a repeat
author: Shaun B.

description: Please don't waste your money in this place. Tourist trap, horrible food, worst service.
author: Purpleabism A.

description: If I could give this restaurant less than 1 Star, I absolutely would. They are scheming and are a rip off. Women hand out coupons saying that you get a free potstickers and ice cream with the purchase. The image shows 4 potstickers. In actuality, you only receive 1. In addition, these potstickers that are allegedly free are deducted from your purchase. Also, the dimsum platter that is supposed to be 18.75 total is actual per person. And of course, all of this is mentioned at the end of the meal and without notice. The bill for 2 people for horrible food was 67.00. Do not come here ever.
author: Jane S.

description:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS! We were wandering around Chinatown in San Fran around 9pm. There were slim pickings for open places. We passed by a nice lady in front of a place handing out a flyer for free potstickers outside of the restaurant. It seemed like a great choice I.E who doesn't love free things!? We were led up a narrow flight of stairs to the second level dining room. Once inside, there were several people enjoying their meals.We were a little more optimistic. 

It was all downhill from there. Our waitress was very rude and curt. It was not a language barrier/cultural difference, she acted like she could care less to be there. I inquired about the coupon for free potstickers and she informed me they had chicken in them. No big deal, I told her that was fine, we would pass. She mumbled something about " I will get you something" and came out with a plate of chex mix and sesame sticks. I about fell on the floor. I couldn't believe that she just set that down. Anyhoo, the food came. We ordered the family style vegetable fried rice ( AMAZING), the Chinese mixed vegetables ( GREAT flavor) and the tempura vegetables (DISGUSTING/NO FLAVOR/TASTED LIKE PURE OIL). In addition, we ordered two soda's, which were served in a can/no refills. 

She brought the bill and we about fell out of our chair. Everything is hand written on your check, and it is very hard to read. This is clearly on purpose. Our bill should have been roughly $30.00. She brought us the check that read $43.00! We overheard another table questioning their bill as well. We paid the amount. Lesson learned. I would never recommend this place to anyone.
author: Jessica S.

description:
DO NOT GO THERE! Only giving one star because i have to. It is expensive. The food tastes okay, but now we're all sick to our stomachs. We went in as a sudden decision and i regret not yelping first. 
I repeat. DO NOT GO THERE!
author: Luisa L.

description: If I can give zero stars I would. The food and service was horrible not even exaggerating.... I asked for a straw and they basically threw it at me. They were yelling at customers and they charged me 58 plus tip 68 plus a fee for swiping the card 72 wth! Unbelievable do NOT GO THERE THE FOOD WAS TRASH AS WELL
author: Michell C.

description:
* AVOID THIS PLACE* Strange and weird experience.  These people are money hungry and have no decency to give you any value for your money.  Food was ridiculously horrible and expensive. Bill came to $ 31.45, I left $31.50 cash on table and headed for the exit. The Waitress chased after me and said that I didn't leave a tip. I told her "your food is nasty." If i was white i could be call a racist for saying that in a chinese restaurant but I am asian and know how much VALUE in food asian restaurant owners give you for your money. I am disgusted and offended by food they served and how shameless they acted. 

NO STAR! 
If you used your credit card to pay, then  see the other reviews about getting over charged.
author: Ush U.

description: I honestly don't understand how 80% of reviewers had such a bad experience here. I honestly thought this place was one of the better restaurants in Chinatown. The food was decent, nothing outstanding, but nothing horrible either. The duck wrap was probably my favorite dish. The upstairs dining area is actually really spacious and the balcony outside is really cute. It would have been nice if the balcony area was a little bigger though because unless your party is 3 or less people, you're not going to fit outside. Service was a little slow and lacking. I would give them a pass for the language barrier, but like it was a pain getting them to refill our tea pot.
author: Alex N.

description:
DO. NOT. EAT. HERE!

if I could give zero stars, I would! Expensive and small portions ! Never again will I go here. Not worth it. Oh... They will add a tip to your bill, whether you want to or not. Even if you're by yourself. SMH!!
author: Oscar S.

description: I wish I could put a Zero.  Worst service ever, bathrooms are dirty and they brought us in with a coupon that they did not honor.  Manager was rude then tried to make up for it at the end but it was too late fir me.  Good Luck if you go here.
author: Abe D.

description: This is a tourist trap! Do not come here! They will automatically add 18% on top of your bill. In America, you get to choose how much tip to give, even ZERO. DO NOT GIVE THEM THE 18% TIP! Just pay them your total price without tips!
author: ZhiCheng Z.

description:
When I went here with my SO, she noticed that her fried rice had bits of broken egg shell in it. We waited very patiently for our waitress to come back and ask how the food was so that we could alert her to the issue, but she never came back. When a different waitress asked if we were done, we said yes, but it still took at least 5 minutes for anyone to come to our table. A third waiter asked if we wanted our check from across the room, again never approaching our table. 

When he came by with the check, I pointed out to him that there were broken egg shells in my SO's meal (which she stopped eating after ingesting a piece of it), he said it was our fault for not telling them earlier. I explained that no one had walked by our table to check on us. I said that we did not feel we shohld pay for her friend rice. He refused to even apologize or do anything but blame, so I asked to speak to the manager. 

The manager came and we told her what the issue was. She did not seem to think it was a big deal that my SO ingested egg shells. She said we could feel free to not tip on our bill. However, we weren't going to leave a big tip anyway due to the very slow speed and lack of attentiveness - we did not see our waitress once after she brought our food.

Apart from the fried rice with egg shells mixed in, the food was pretty much flavorless.

There is no reason to go to this restaurant. I sincerely regret that it happened to be the firsy chinese restaurant we came across in Chinatown that was open between 2:30-5. Oh, and entrees don't come with steamed rice, which is certainly a first from what I'be experienced.

Avoid this place.
author: Daniel T.

description: The service was decent but the food was just terrible. Cost us $100 for 2 adults and 2 children for substandard Chinese food. I really should have checked the rating before walking in. A really big disappointment.
author: Tracy G.

description: Just walked out after waiting 27 minutes to place an order.  And they weren't busy.  Too bad...we've eaten here before and enjoyed it.  But fortunately there is no shortage of good dining options in San Francisco's Chinatown.  We walked 100 feet and were enjoying dinner in no time.
author: William T.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend wanting some authentic Sichuan food.
Everything tasted nasty and flavorless

On top of that, they added 18% tip on the bill?
Like how in the hell you think you deserve that much?!

Never coming back
author: Linwei Y.

description:
Stay clear away from this restaurant. Total tourist scheme. They have ladies giving coupons out for free green tea ice cream if you eat here. More than just a few ppl handing out coupons....luring ppl to eat crappy food. They are a disgrace to the asian culture and have no pride in their food. It's disgusting...do not try. A true asian would know....and that's why they lure mostly non-Asians to the restaurant who most likely won't be familiar with quality Chinese food.

Avoid this place by all means. This place is a scam. Overly priced disgusting sub-standard food. 

Doesn't even deserve 1 star!!!
author: Urs T.

description:
Our first experience four or five years ago was good. Every visit has gotten significantly worse. After having lunch today, hoping for a miracle, we're done. Especially after they're refusing to validate our parking. Apparently if THEY feel you didn't spend enough,  no validation. 
How much did we need to spend?
They didn't know. 
Goodbye Chinatown Restaurant.
author: Sven J.

description:
.....Uhh I hope this is the ONE Star rating (I give a 2 stars because of worker who were passing out flyer and were friendly). I will ever write for a restaurant. This is just the worst experiences I ever have dining at a Chinese Restaurant. It was my first day in San Francisco. Me and my friend were hungry and couldn't pick a place to eat so we just keep walking until we find a good place to eat. I walk by and there was someone passing out the flyer to us and were very friendly. They even show us the way there I was like hmm nice. I should have check the reviews first before stepping in to the door. 

When we got there, the place itself is very quiet. There three to four tables. I'm guessing they are tourist too. This place is literally a tourist trap. When we are seated, the waitress ask me what do I want to drink. I normally drink water, I told her can I get a glass of water. Surprising the waitress shocked me LOL. She asked what kind of water?! She said we have sparkling water, and bottle water! I was like can I just get a glass of normal water lol... 

I was looking at there Dim Sum menu, I found it was a not a little over price and its in Chinatown area! I'm original from the East coast NYC and there Chinatown Dim Sum is fairly cheap. But I guess not in San Fran! It's okay since we are very hungry and just want to grab couple of stuff before getting good food for dinner. We ordered couple Dim Sum dish's and a large house fried rice to share. It takes them pretty long to bring us the foods. That's fine but the quality of there Dim Sum is not satisfying. There fried rice is good but portion is too small when it suppose to be a Large entree. 

Best part is when we get our Check! The price itself is alright. BUT they added the tips itself with a party size of TWO?! Wth?! Even that, I always tip in restaurants even if the food or service is horrible! This place really surprised me. I won't be stopping by here anytime soon. Unless, they changes there system!
author: Jason L.

description:
This place is a tourist trap!!!!

The prices were outrageous for what you get especially since they gave really small portions. Some of the seafood dishes ranged from $30-40 dollars. Read more below for details.

I was showing a friend from Chicago around town, and he wanted to eat in Chinatown despite my warnings that the restaurants in Chinatown aren't that great.  

We were planning to go to Z&Y but it and most of the other restaurants where packed with long waits because of a pre-Chinese New Year's Event. My friend was on a time crunch to catch a train back to the Peninsula, so we went to Chinatown Restaurant because it was half empty and could seat us right away.

The one plus of the place is that they had outdoor seating on the narrow balcony walkways on the second floor. The minus of the outdoor space is that it clearly wasn't built for people to dine on, and I'm pretty sure that they're not up to safety codes. The tables were essentially very small patio tables and with patio chairs which left just enough room for the wait staff to work through. The bad of the outdoor seating is that the tables were so small that it could barely hold the three dishes that we ordered and the table surface was really uneven, so you had to be careful about your drinks.

After looking at the menu, it was clear that the place served Americanized Chinese food which isn't my cup of tea, but perfect for my friend since he wanted General Tso's Chicken and Fried Rice. We ordered these dishes and the Szechuan Beef. I can roll with it.

I was really disappointed by the dishes when they arrived though. First the portions for the beef and chicken dishes were really small. Like half the size of typical Chinese restaurant dishes. The plates that they were served in looked huge and empty in comparison. Plus none of them were very good. 

The General Tso's chicken came out more like Lemon Chicken with soft doughy batter and mostly just sweetness. The whole reason that people like General Tso's is because they deep fry it to get a crunchy exterior with both sweet and savory flavors. Other than the typical mixed vegetables and white rice, the only protein in the fried rice were these very sad dry pieces of Chinese sausage that were pretty small. 

At $16 per tiny stir fry dish and $10 for the fried rice which was pretty much all rice with almost no meat, it just really wasn't worth it. And these were the cheaper things on the menu. Their whole fish dish was $43!!!  Prices have been creeping up for whole fish dishes at Chinese restaurants in the Bay Area, but that's just obscene. The allure of Chinese food is that you get cheap really delicious food.  This was neither.

They did give us a small scoop of free ice cream at the end and two potstickers and the staff was generally nice, but I guess that I'd be pretty nice and feeling pretty good too if I were making that kinda cash overcharging people.
author: Lee H.

description:
Where's our food??

Well, I can see why this place is rated only 2 stars at the most. The service is bad!!! (-0- Star). We received our food an hour after we placed our order. We ordered five things: Hong Kong Style Crispy Noodles, Chef's House Special Fried Rice, Sesame Chicken, Mongolian Beef (not spicy), and (self-serve) Shrimp Sizzling Rice Soup. We were hangry!!!

It took the servers a long time to bring us our food. I suppose it's not their fault, the cooks probably couldn't keep up with the amount of patrons that they are trying to lure from the streets of Chinatown. Workers from the restaurant were giving out coupons (free potstickers and green tea ice-cream) on the streets to get people to eat in the restaurant. Water refills came few and far in between and we have to flag a server. We don't have a dedicated one for our table. There must've been like five different ones who tended to us.

Once we got our food, though, it was delicious (+1 star). Each meal that we ordered were tasty, crunchy and, overall, our meals satisfied our hunger. The pan-fried noodles came before the sizzling rice soup. The soup was served and I was used to the server preparing this for us which is they usually bring in the soup and crunchy rice on separate plate/bowl (which they did), then they were supposed to dump the rice in the hot soup which was supposed to make the "sizzling" sound (therefore the name 'Sizzling Rice Soup')... well, no sizzle and we had to serve ourselves.  When it came time to pay our bill that came late as well and the payment transaction time took long too. -sigh-

The portions were small for the price of each dish. Our total was $116+ including tip. There were six of us in our party and they automatically added a 20% tip for their sucky service. Boo! The restaurant building has four levels. Most of the guests were escorted to the second level. Restrooms were located on the first level and basement. Parking? Good luck!

Review #0403
author: May A.

description: I would say the food is 4 star, but the prices are too steep for what it is. Service is a bit strange. What we ordered was items from the dim-sum menu. Shrimp rice roll and beef skewers. Both were fresh, delicious, and nice portions. However,  with tax and tip, this small meal cost us $20. They did give us a complimentary ice cream desert at the end of our meal, which was nice.
author: Marta M.

description: Had lunch here today while visiting from Southern, CA.  Not sure why the overall rating is 2.  Some of the specialty items on the menu like Peking Duck were pretty high priced, but clearly marked on the menu, other items were more reasonably priced.  We had a relatively light lunch for three.  We got an order of soup dumplings (Shanghai Pork), an order of BBQ Pork Buns, a free order of potstickers, and green tea ice cream because they gave us a coupon when we arrived.  We only ordered one entree, Green Bean with Tofu and added a couple of sides of white rice.  One of us had a beer and we all had hot tea.  The bill was 42 dollars before tip.  I reviewed the bill with the owner and everything added up correctly.  All of the food was very good to excellent.
author: Bob T.

description: The entries we got were good and flavorful, but the wait for our "free" potstickers and ice cream was long. Not to mention, the servers were so busy with other tables that they often forgot what we asked and got side tracked
author: Slidey S.

description: This place at first sight I thought it was going to be average at the most. Turned out to become a great place. We had a great waitress that had some good recommendations and was perfect for us to stay away until food was ready or a drink needed to be filled. We ordered a wonton soup, which could feed two-three people, and it was amazing. Had a great broth and chucks of chicken that was fresh and didn't seem over cooked or old chicken that sat in the water. Then we had spring rolls that were great and fresh. I do recommend these with there sweet sour sauce on the table. It brought out some of the flavors in the rolls. The wife had the chief special chicken fried rice, which was great just by itself but we mixed our meals. I order a chicken with the General in its name. It says spicy but had no spice. It was flavorful and was great with the chiefs fried rice. I hope you give this place a chance. I would come back again and plan to next time I go to Chinatown.
author: Reese C.

description:
My coworker and I found this place while looking for another restaurant but technically it found out because the restaurant has a bunch of women on he street giving out flyers for free potstickers with purchase and letting you know they have dim sum all day. 
1. Dim sum selection is small
2. It's a tourist restaurant so no locals.
3. Small portions even when you order a family size it's the size of abnormal plate at regular Chinese restaurant. 
4. Over priced and your not paying for ambiance.
Besides that the BBQ pork ribs are to die for if you are in the mood and everything else is just okay.
author: Sandy S.

description:
I wouldn't suggest eating here. My boyfriend and his mom and I were looking for a place to eat so we were walking around trying to find a spot. There were about 2 ladies on the streets passing out flyers for free potstickers and green tea ice cream. I mean who doesn't like free? So one lady led us to the restaurant and it was on the second floor. We had to walk up a steep flight of stairs. The bathrooms were located on the first floor which was really inconvenient.

To start off, the service was very slow. They did not really check up on us to see if we needed anything. You could see that they were like that with everyone else too because everyone kept looking around to see where their waiters/waitresses were. There was even one family that walked out and didn't even order anything. Onto, the food itself. It wasn't that great. The portions were small and presentation wasn't that great either. Pretty sure they didn't care about presentation. Anyway, when we tried to pay, they added about a 17% tip into our bill. We were confused as to why they did that because there was only 3 of us. When it was brought to the waiters attention and she was told that we were not paying that tip, she took it off. SO MAKE SURE TO CHECK YOUR BILL IF YOU DO DECIDE TO EAT HERE! 

After we finished eating, we decided to check the ratings of this place on yelp. We saw it only had one and a half stars with 500+ reviews. Not only did it have low ratings but on here, it also said that the food safety was poor. That concerned us a lot. Luckily none of us had an food poisoning or our stomachs were agitated.
author: Jaleena F.

description: Watch your bill!  My bill was $62 but rang up as $81... when I asked about it I was told it was "gratuity"... 30% gratuity on a sim sim dinner for 2? No Bueno... I was then given the option to pay my own tip.... good Luck!!!
author: Zachary K.

description:
Food? Fantastic- we had the Dim Sum Sampler
Service? Amazing - we sat outside and she still kept great tabs on us. 
Great value and very clean. We are so glad we found this gem amongst so many choices
author: Laura M.

description: Me and my friend read on here that they add an 18% tip automatically so we didn't leave a tip. As we were leaving the restaurant the lady calls us back and asks why we did not leave one. We tell her that we did not have enough to leave a tip and then she continues to question us, telling us it is the law to pay a tip in America. She would not let us leave until we gave a tip and kept on telling us that it is mandatory & an actual law in America that you have to leave a tip. It was not until we brought up on our phone that tipping is a courtesy and not a law. 0/10 would recommend especially since you get harassed by the employees!
author: Sidney W.

description: We arrived with a party of 13(after walking over Lombard Street) and were seated quickly, thankfully.  The drinks came in a timely fashion and kept coming.  We ordered the 26.00 per person (about) family meal with the most delicious duck I've ever had.  All the food was tasty and we could not finish everything.  I wish I could recall more plates and may amend with some pictures and more info.  The balcony allowed for a view of the parade outside which was an added bonus.  I tried every plate and all were fantastic.  We had a great time there and will be  back.
author: Jack P.

description: Outstanding food, great service, don't know what the people were talking about.  Price is little high; but what isn't in San Francisco!!  Great balcony  for pictures and view of town!  Made our lunch special!
author: Curtis E.

description: Service was bad. It took exceptionally long for a server to come over (we came at a quiet time) and she was quite rude and impatient. Food was pretty tasty, but very overpriced for what it was, and took forever to come out. On top of that, we were never served the drinks we asked for. This place is a tourist trap, don't fall for the people outside trying to lure you in!
author: Nicole K.

description: I'm very surprised at the amount of bad reviews this place has received. My husband and I are there today and our food was delicious.  Service was adequate and although the price was a little high, I believe the food was great. The green tea ice cream was delicious too!
author: Pamela G.

description: As I was reading a review while eating there about finding eggshell pieces in the fried rice I actually bit into a couple of them. Could of used more flavor. Nice and quiet environment.
author: Stacey D.

description: Food was ok, what you need to watch out for is the added price for tea, everyother place gives for free, then they automatically ad a tip no matter how many people we only had three. Ordered small soup and they didn't want to give us bowls to share
author: Craig H.

description: Do not go here!!!! This place scammed us! Definitely overcharged us. They charged gratuity for a party of 3. They just want to take your money. The food wasn't bad but it wasn't great. I like hot food and my food was just warm. I will never go here again because of the fact that they overcharged us. Really not an honest place. Not worth the money, trust me
author: Mary M.

description:
Not as horrible as everyone thinks it is. If you're visiting Chinatown, this might not be the best option (there's an abundance of restaurants that are rated much higher) however tourists and late night eaters seem to gravitate towards this restaurant due to the ladies handing out coupons directly outside of the premises. 

We had the honey walnut shrimp, sweet and sour chicken, and chicken/corn soup. 
Honey walnut shrimp was amazing (huge portion and you really could taste the quality). Couldn't really say the same about the chicken and soup; no flavor in either and didn't seem fresh. 

Ambiance was nice enough, but the service was subpar at best. The servers ignored us repeatedly and were a bit rude. 

Can't say much about the tip, since we had a large party and we probably would've tipped the 20% anyways. All in all, You could definitely find far better restaurants within Chinatown.
author: Kristen E.

description: Food was average. It was cold when it arrived at the table. Prices high for what you get.
author: Diane C.

description: We are in Chinatown for dinner.  We just got a coupon for free potstickers and green tea ice cream.  The lady is standing on the corner of Grant and Washington.  We ordered shrimp dumplings perfectly steamed. The Hong King style noodles were delicious. Cooked perfectly. I loved my steamed sea bass.  I took pictures of part of the menu for descriptions or our order and prices.  Very quiet and serene and comfortable. The sun shines through the second floor window. A lot of beautiful pictures on the wall of times before.
author: Rose Marie J.

description: Food was fast and people were nice, but the quality could have been better. And the pork dumplings were in little tinfoil cups so they collected waster and you had to drain them before eating.
author: David G.

description: This restaurant is as bad as they say it is. We were walking by when a lady ran out and literally started pushing us inside. We thought how bad could it be and we hadn't eaten yet so we allowed ourselves to be hurded in. The food was abysmal. Hair and foreighn objects in food. Undercooked chicken. Beef had a very strange fishy iron taste. Soup had so much salt that it could not be consumed and that is not an over exaggeration. Like drinking soy sauce without the good flavor. Staff was rude. Establishment was filthy. Check was overcgarged and had 18% required gratuity in addition to the overcharge. Oh and kikoman soy sauce dispenser was filled with vinegar not soy sauce so beware ruining your whole plate of already bad food because you think the bottle that says soy sauce is indeed not soy sauce.
author: Andrew H.

description: Do not come! We randomly chose this one, thinking no Chinese restaurant in China town can be bad. But we were wrong. As Chinese, we can tell you that this is not a traditional Chinese restaurant, but a place to rob non-Chinese customers. No one come to place order until we ask them to after sitting here for 20 minuets. And we have to ask them for plates and cups after 10 minutes of placing orders. And the taste of food is just fine -- not even as good as my cooking... oh, the most important one is that they over charged twice as regular Chinese food. And last, they forced 20% tips by default shamelessly!!! Feels soooooo bad for our lunch and never ever visit here. Be careful and do not come!
author: Wen T.

description: We paid for our meal and left- the meat was slimy and the potstickers tasted sour. we did not want to gamble with the idea of food poisoning so paid our $48 tab and enjoyed the wrapped fortune cookies, most expensive fortune cookies we have ever had. Steer clear of this place.
author: Katie D.

description: Absolutely awful.  The service was terrible.  The waitress walked away while my husband was in mid sentence. (TWICE)  The only thing worse than the service was the food.  This is a major tourist trap.  I did not think that you could find a bad restaurant in Chinatown.  Not true!
author: Marcia K.

description: I don't care that this place has one and a half stars on yelp. It's my favorite. So good!
author: Bobby N.

description:
This is a traditional Chinatown restaurant,  with a second floor restaurant and upper balcony event space with a great view of the city.  The ILs love it here.  I was suspicious with the first restaurant solicitor on the street.

The hostess seats you at a butcher paper-covered table and brings menus. We ask for hot tea and water. One person gets a water. One small menu is a dim sum sampler for $16.95pp. Nowhere does it say minimum 2 people. The server gets an attitude and writes $20.95 on the table paper and circles it, speaking to me like I'm an idiot. She was either nasty or non-existent for the entire meal.

The man orders a fish and veggie dish. The battered fish and bok choy was superb.  The appetizers were free pork potstickers. Those were hot and tasty as well.  The ILs ordered Chow Mein and shrimp in lobster sauce with snow peas. They had to pretty much beg for steamed rice with the meal.

My order comes,  and is promptly put in the center of the table, even though it's my meal. The steam baskets had potstickers, a pork bun and shumai. The plate had a chicken skewer, a spring roll and some other fried goodie. There were several listed items that never appeared,  such as spare ribs.

Dessert was a very tasty green tea ice cream. We never got beverage refills though, and there were flies everywhere. 

For a party of 4, this was not a $125 plus tax meal.  Do also note: they auto add gratuity,  no matter what. My guess is because they're mean.
author: Kat P.

description: Don't get sucked in by the ladies in the street with coupons. Dim sum is $3.95 and up but there's only 1 item that's $3.95. The rest are $5 or $6. Slow service. They added a 17% tip to our bill which we refused to pay so the waitress took it off. The food was okay. Small servings for the price.
author: Justin P.

description: Worse Chinese food ever for the price. At $20 a dish we expected a bit more taste. Everything is so bland and no Ssuce for the duck! The service is mediocre. ! Would not come back.
author: Elysa T.

description: I have been here twice and both on times, I had a pleasant experience. Ordered various dim sum dishes and it was all delicious. Service was great as well. Both times I sat in the balcony which has a neat view of China town and downtown SF. I will likely be coming back the next time that I am in the city.
author: Paul H.

description: Horrible service and expensive! The food was not that great and they charge mandatory tips which for us was $42 even if the service was horrible. I had to get up to remind the servers about our drinks and food they forgot to give us (place was not that busy for them to forget our table) If it were up to me I would not give them any stars! I do not reccomend this place at all.
author: Sally M.

description: Food was pretty yummy..... it as other reviews stated, didn't love that a tip was automatically added to the bill with the so-so service we received.  Food was quick too come out.  The Lo-mein (or they called it chow-mein) was delicious!  The pork BBQ buns were good.  I didn't care for the shrimp rolls, but my friend thought they were good.  Bathroom is pretty shady!  But an authentic pit stop while in Chinatown
author: Kaylee C.

description: The food here and service was amazing. The dim sum was delicious we got a plate that had 2 pieces of 9 different types of foods with chow-mein! It was very yummy. Very underrated by reviews!!
author: Francisco J.

description:
If you are in the mood for classic chinatown food and decor then look no further! We had delicious dim sum treats and fun service. While nothing fancy it really is a fun place for the chinatown experience:
tasty classic Chinese food
lively decorations
great balcony
attentive staff.

I would absolute recommend this to anyone looking to enjoy SF chinatown.

Also, we hosted an event here and they did a great job! We are already planning next year's event with them as well!
author: coolidgedecides o.

description: Foods are so salty. Nothing special. We was tricked by a lady on the street with free dumplings and ice cream. But they took me $7 automatic tip on $30 foods. I did not see and gave them $5 for tip again. Thats not make sense. The stupid lesson that I leant from this restaurant.
author: Thuy Tien X.

description: Now let me just say that this review is more about the service than the food. The food is not bad. I've certainly had both better and worse, this is right down the middle. Good, but nothing to write home to mom about. What I really didn't like was that they wrote in their own tip of 18%. Now while service wasn't horrible, it wasn't 18% tip territory good. I'd understand if we had a large party, but there were 3 of us. Besides coming over to ask if we wanted more alcohol, we weren't checked on at all and had to ask for our bill and boxes. Oh, and they charge for hot tea too. Check your bills, people.
author: Stephanie C.

description: not authentic at all. serves ketchup in place of sweet and sour sauce!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
author: Michelle L.

description: My friends and I stopped here with a nice Ad. After dinner, we got the check with 20% tips add on. And we had a party of 4 people. They had no right to add it since this is not a big party. NOT RECOMMENDED TO COME HERE
author: Daniel N.

description: Worst Chinese food I've ever had!!!! Waitress hustled us in then I asked if they have salt and pepper pork and she said yes then when we ordered they said they don't have. We couldn't leave anymore because we ordered our drinks. Then I used the restroom and it smelled like pee all over. By the way they charged 20% gratuity for 5 people but the menu didn't show they charged gratuity for 6 or more. Worst restaurant ever!!! Not coming back!!! Food is not even great!!!
author: AnnaAndnoli E.

description: The food was bland, the service was poor.  The bill was suspect with the tip written in.  The people at the next table were offered different menus than we were.
author: Kari N.

description: Don't do it!!! They rip you off by adding unauthorized funds to your bill after you leave. Along with the fact that dishes are over priced for the amount of food you receive. Our bill came out to $52.40 for three dishes, I left a cash tip and wrote the exact amount of the bill on their copy of the receipt. Two days later I checked my account to find $62.40 deducted from my account. They are sneaky and lack integrity. Moral of the story, don't dine at this sorry excuse of a restaurant.
author: Jolay M.

description: Food is ok. Be careful with the tip. They include automatically add a tip on the bill, then they give you a receipt with the option to add more tip. Seems kinda sketchy if you ask me.
author: Jose R.

description: Not a pleasant experience at all! Out of kindness we accepted a coupon from a woman on the street with absolutely no intention of eating here. We were then personally escorted down the street, into the restaurant and seated at a table. Deciding to give the place a shot, plus we did have previously mentioned coupon, we ordered after quite the price shock. Food was average and our pork shu mai was raw in the middle once we finally received; they still tried charging us for it even though we sent it back. Would not recommend this place at all! House of Nanking is much better and there onion cake is leagues above this place. One star rating is only because cause zero is not an option.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Coming here means the chow mein you ordered is cold, service is extremely slow, and they add a "tips" line to your bill. When you ask, they say "this is only a suggestion." The bill makes the tip appear to be mandatory like what the other yelpers suggested in their comment.
author: Tim S.

description: Tips were mandatory.. and I ordered 1 thing and they brought 2. Anyhow, I have to paid for both of them and are only one. Seriously not a good experience!
author: Uplaksh K.

description: Food was good only complaint was that it could have been hotter, food came out just warm.
author: K R.

description:
As we were walking around trying to find a place to eat a very nice young lady handed us s coupon for free potstickers and ice cream. The restaurant was quite charming and appeared clean. Food was mediocre/poor. We paid 16.98 pp for family meal. The chicken skewers were very dry. Chicken fried rice was bland with zero flavor. Service was ok.  Now time for the check. A hand written check I immediately surmised tax evasion. That wasn't the most shocking. There four of us. They added an 18% tip. I was infuriated. The food and taxes came to $79.xx. The nerve of these people. I paid only the food and tax; no tip whatsoever!!  I paid in cash to avoid running my card for the full amount. Which they probably pocketed. For of those that are unaware, a tip is not a requirement even if the menu states they add tip. I sat at the table waiting for them to approach me after I gave them the $79.xx, they never did. 

I do not recommend. I would spend your money elsewhere.
author: JJ M.

description:
This place has roaches

Bullshit restaurant.. Stay away. They make sure you don't leave after they get you to walk on through that door. 

We walked in they sat us in the back of the restaurant took our drink order. Tried convincing us of getting sodas instead of water cups(didn't work) we put our food order in and sit there. We're a party of 12 all family. My niece looks down and there by the side of her chair one cockroach is crawling next to her (eeeeuuuuwww) my cousin looks down and there goes the second. These roaches are alive in the restaurant. My cousin gets up and walks to the front pools the owner/manager to the side and shows her the pictures we took. She comes over with her little server to pick them up says she is going to knock off $40 from our bill. 

We sit there uncomfortable trying to eat. Then the table next to us, lady gets up with her plate and walks to the front. Manager comes over we can't hear much but we know they found something. We hear the manager tell her they will give her a 50% discount. Our bill comes and it's about $270(bullshit) 

*food sucks 
*place has roaches 
*people are complaining 

These people added a $40.85 tip to our bill. Really that is straight bullshit. We gave them $200 and walked out of that place. This place deserves 0 stars
author: Fabby G.

description: This might literally be the worst Chinese restaurant in Chinatown. Everything you read in the other one-star reviews are true. Food is horrible beyond belief (microwaved potstickers, beef chow fun that is both burned and cold and clumpy), they add "suggested" tips to your bill total, and service is pretty non-existent. Avoid at all costs. Go to McDonalds.
author: Joe C.

description:
Free potstickers and ice cream . But you pay for it at the end when they add 18% gratuity for just a party of two . Glad I read the yelp reviews after sitting down because I would of tipped an extra $10. So if you think about it , they are making a lot of money !! They would of made almost $19 tip ! They do not label the gratuity on the check either - so look after your total
And you will see the extra $ ! 

Sitting outside was great - food was fine . No water - must buy bottled water . 

I normally check yelp for reviews but this one almost slipped - I would never go to such a low rating restaurant . But sitting outside upstairs was my tourist trap!
author: Cheryl W.

description:
Out of all the times we've passed this place, we were starving and finally gave in. Sure this place is historical but they need to revamp it! 

There's a menu out front on the building with no prices. Then they give you a menu when you get in. Then the actual menu in the restaurant has higher prices. I asked about it and the lady said those were take out prices. I'm guessing price changes here. They are desperate for customers. They really need new owners. This place is also VERY expensive. 

There were many different people that were serving us. We were given a plate of kimchi and gyoza. The gyoza we knew for sure was complimentary but we thought they added the kim chi as well. We start eating and talking. A waiter comes by and takes our plate away. We tell him we weren't finished with the kim chi. He says but you didn't order it. I feel as though we didn't, we were already eating it so why take it away? There was a lot of confusion. Let's just say that waiter didn't come back up again. He knew he made a boo boo. This place is poorly organized. I supposed they aren't used to having so much traffic. 

We were then served our combination chow fun. So good! One critique is onions to big and raw. 

The honey prawns were amazing! Big crunchy and Cooked at just the perfect amount of time. 

I really wished this place would get a new owner. Such a prime destination with high prices and few customers. Such a waste.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Automatically adding 18% gratuity on your own is not good practice.  
There is a reason this restaurant received only a 1.5 rating.  The worst part about our experience is that they AUTOMATICALLY ADDED 18% GRATUITY/TIP (the waitress wrote it in manually), even though we did not tell them.  I'm not sure How or WHY they think they can add 18% without asking the customer.  My husband did not agree to them doing it and asked them why they did that - but he decided to let it go.  Sadly, we will not be returning.  
Tip to Managers:  Please note it is up to the customers to decide how much tip you get - not you. We were planning on leaving 15% anyway even though we truly should have left less.  
This practice is a good way to turn-off your customers - not good for your business.  Please let your customers decide on their own how much tip to leave.
author: Grace A.

description: This place has a poor food safety problem. Their menu clearly states that their sodas cost $2 yet we were charged $6 for one can of sprite. We stopped in for a quick snack and all of the employees were crabby that we only ordered a couple things. They weren't pleasant about anything. I would not recommend going here at all. Their food tasted like it was bought Safeway. Don't go here unless you want bad service bad food and to get ripped off.
author: Mariko T.

description:
RUN AS FAR AWAY AS FAST AS YOU CAN.   This place is insane.  They lure you in with the promise of free potstickers and free macha ice cream.   They allow you (apparently) .6 free potstickers per person.  For three people we were told we would get two potstickers.   Next, the lady that took our order was nice, but took it wrong and argued with me about it later.  When you order a drink you get a can or bottle and a cup of ice.  If they see your glass getting low, they just come pour more out of your can or bottle against your will.   No more ice.  

They also do things like ask you if you would like fried rice instead of steamed while not telling you it costs double.  If you ask if you can get plain fried rice without the chicken or veggies in it they say SURE no problem and then still charge you $8.95 for a plate of plain rice with some egg and soy sauce that was tossed on the grill for two minutes.  If I had known it was going to cost so much I would have just gone with plain rice.

The food itself wasn't bad.  But it wasn't anything special either.  It's all Americanized.  

If you want water they don't serve tap water so you have to buy a bottle of water.

We had the sweet & sour chicken (no rice), the "free" potstickers, three drinks, an order of pork steam buns (3), and a plate of pretend fried rice, and four wrapped shrimps was $42.20   and they wanted a $7.55 tip (18%).  

I adjusted my tip down for the poor service (they brought someone else's food to our table and set it down and we had to ask them to take it away and they just set it on the right table).  Plus it irks me to pay tip on tax.  So I gave 15% on amount before tax.

Overall this was a horrible experience for our vacation.  This is NOT what you want.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
My boyfriend and I arrived in SF pretty late and wanted dim sum, so we ended up coming here as it was one of the only places still open. The food itself was not bad- we shared the dim sum combo and the roast duck, and although sub-par, it in itself does not warrant a 1-star review.

However, the service was absolutely atrocious. Their menu states that they add 18% gratuity for parties of 5+, but when we received the bill, they had already added an 18% tip. We asked why the tip was included already, since we were only a party of two. It was simply a polite inquiry on our side, as we generally tip 18-20% wherever we go. But our question was met with complete hostility - "So you don't want to tip?!"

I asked for them to remove the charge so that I can decide my own tip amount. They refused. Fine- I told them that they had charged my card without my permission, and if they would not process the charge correctly, I would just go through my CC company for a chargeback. Immediately, she refunded the charges and brought back a correct bill, and again, asking how much we would tip. We were pretty pissed at this point, so we just said "3%", and the three ladies at our table blew up stating that "10% is standard!" and "that's not acceptable!"

Well, you know what else isn't acceptable? Charging someone's card without their permission.

So yeah, I tipped 3%, and recommend you get Taco Bell instead.
author: Juliana M.

description: Average Chinese food at best but service was pretty bad. Food was rather expensive as well.
author: Jared L.

description: Very kind young waiters, great Chinatown restaurant for a quick bite when you're hungry tourists! Yummy green tea ice cream following purchase of entree.
author: Janet W.

description:
This place is good. And I'm from L.A. and am picky. 

The free dumplings were yummy. And not just kuz they are free haha. 

We loved the shrimp rice rolls. 

Sweet and sour chicken is crispy and not greasy. Liked it.

Seafood fried rice is expensive. close to $20 but at least it has scallops and wasn't overgreasy. It was good but I admit I was surprised by the price considering it is fried rice. 

Free green tea with fortune cookie. Cute. 

Party of 4 and they listed a tip amount. Didn't pay what they listed because we aren't required to pay that amount. We all found that strange. 

Overall: food is good. Place is underrated
author: Patricia K.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE!!!  6 of us ate there last night, dragged in by a woman handing out flyers on the corner...

They offer free appetiser and ice-cream....totally inedible!!

They are currently under inspection by the health Dept fr so many complaints of their dirty food handling!!

The staff were REALLY RUDE to everyone around us, vacuuming around us and almost threw the food on the table!!
Our bill came with 20% tip automatically added.....they do this to everyone???
We told them to remove it as the food and lack of service was so disgusting!!
AVOID THIS PLACE!!! YUK
author: Lili D.

description:
If 0 stars were an option, I'd give it! 
Complete tourist trap!!!
2 adults 1 child = $96 effing bill! 
2 beers, 1 ginger ale, 4 dim sum and one entree. 
Handwritten check in which was strategically placed an 18% tip which was NOT deserved. 
Sadly, we buckled, paid and FLED. 
Do NOT expect spectacular food or service.  
Having been a server, I know what one should deliver for 18%. Neither the food or service qualified.
author: K Z.

description: The worst place EVER!!! First, it took them about 10 minutes to come over and take the orders. Never came back to check on us during the time we stayed. Also, they included tips themselves, which they did NOT deserve!!!! Never coming back and would not recommend to anyone. Took 20 minutes to pay the bill. Ridiculous!!!!
author: Angelkarolina1 ..

description: Food is pretty good but the service is super slow.  If you are not in a rush and not type A then it's a good place to go.  If you are in a rush or impatient person you might start yelling at someone :).
author: Jeff M.

description:
Food is not good. I'm pretty sure you would know what that means.
Also service is bad food takes long n if your a tourist they'll take your order first but if your local they don't care about you. Some food are serve cold.
author: Saige A.

description: We were lured here by a flyer for free dumplings. The food wasn't bad I have to admit. The waitress was just as quick as I was suckered into the place. She charged us a large tip, almost 30%. Another thing is, I was very hungry. So, maybe the food wasn't that great.
author: Israel S.

description: This Restaurant makes the Freshest Chef Special Fried Rice, Ever! With so Much Flavor!  You don't Even need Table Salt. Even the Hot Tea is so Delicious! If you're ever in San Francisco, it's a Must that you Stop Here!
author: Lillian G.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here despite their horrible reviews because we were staring and almost everyone had stopped serving dim sum for the day. A lady on the street corner flagged us down and showed us the menu, and we decided to just go with it. 

Upon arriving, we weren't greeted by anyone other than the street corner lady showing us to our table. After about 10 minutes sitting there, a woman came and took our order. We noticed that most of their traffic was coming from the street corner lady, and consisted mostly of tourists. 

After ordering some dim sum (pork bun, shrimp dumpling, and shrimp with rice noodle), we asked for hot tea. It was really low quality, with loose tea leaves in each sip. Most places offer hot tea complimentary with a meal, but they actually charged us $3! 

The food arrived and it was very low quality. The shrimp was hardly deveined, and the dumpling and egg noodles over cooked. 

For these 3 things it ended up being close to $25. Such a waste of money! Do yourself a favor and skip this trap. Bad service, gross food, and way over priced.
author: Angela F.

description:
Terrible service! Lets not talk about food first, we called to reserve a ROOM, and I clearly said we do not want to be distarcted. The phoner gave me the brush-off and tried to hang the phone asap. 
We eventually ended up sharing with another table !!! and the resturant blamed on the phoner was new and did not try to do some make ups for their mistake!
btw the food is bad compared to other chinese resturants.
author: 烽

description: Try the pot stickers!! And the Green Beans! Definitely come in groups it's very convenient! Family size!
author: Esme M.

description:
WILL NEVER EVER EVER EAT HERE AGAIN. I was in a party of 3, we sat down and were just handed menus and were never asked if we wanted any drinks. About 20 minutes later I had to ASK if we can order drinks and place our orders. 10 minutes later we received our soda and still did not receive the other 2 waters we ordered at the same time. After placing our order 30 minutes ago, we received one of our orders.. Not all 3 but ONE order. 15 minutes later we received our 2nd order. 

Now during this time of waiting our waiter NEVER came to check up on us or give us refills. As the other two people were almost finished eating I asked again where my food was and they said it was on its way out. 20 minutes later I received the wrong order because they had forgot what I ordered. It was not busy at 8pm when we arrived either. So 15 minutes later I received my order after almost an hour an a half of waiting and watching my group eat. 

The food was actually decent but I was so distracted by the service we recieved I couldn't even enjoy my food. We asked for the check a few minutes later. 

We were given the check 30 minutes later and we were over charged almost $20. When I asked why they said the tip was included because we were there past 10pm. Even though we got there at 8 and I waited almost 2 hours for my food to come out. I told our waitress I didn't want to include the tip and she gave me attitude and took my check and went to the back. She came back later and only took $7 off. I asked what the rest of the over charge was and she said it was taxes. 

My bill was only suppose to be $48 with tax and they wanted to charge us $66.00. We decided just to get it over with and pay our over priced bill so we could get out of that awful place. 

Not only were we waiting but there were also 5 other groups waiting and it was so bad that a few people who were still waiting on their food or already recieved their order and their party didn't actually got up and left or canceled their orders because no one checked up on anyone or let us know where our food was unless we bugged them and when we asked they would just say it's coming right out. 

WE WERE THERE FOR ALMOST 2 1/2 hours. We didn't leave till almost 11pm. AWFUL SERVICE and they try to add unexpected charges to your bill hoping you don't notice. I highly recommend never going there. And I'm not one to say anything if I get bad service or even say something to the waitress but it was seriously so bad I couldn't believe it. The party I was with couldn't believe it. 

So if they try to hand you coupons as you're walking past and try to bring you in please just say no and find a better place to eat. I hope this review helps. Don't want anyone else getting ripped off.
author: Theresa P.

description:
Let me start from the beginning! My friend and I went to Chinatown, I mean come on its Chinatown  there is this lady passing out flyers right in the corner of Grant and Washington. As some of you would say "ushering" us. NO! It felt more like harassing. She had her hand on our back and took us all the way to the restaurant... I mean she didn't force but... I just don't like to be "ushered" or pressured OK finally we walk in. I was thinking, "You know. I don't think it will be bad here." I liked the environment. It was actually pretty decent. 

Fast forward: the host sat us down. We were waiting more than 10 minutes for someone to come over and offer us drinks and to take our order. Finally this waitress comes. No customer service at all. She has such a rude affect, flat expression. I mean go home if you're going to be like that... we asked for water didn't bring it. One thing is we didn't wait a lot for our food to come. Our dishes came pretty fast :) thats about the ONLY GOOD THING
 
Our food was pretty decent not bad..the quality wasn't the best but it wasn't the worst. I was pretty upset with the waitress before but than we got a new one and she was so sweet. I was like ok. I will give you a good tip. Than the other one came back with the same expression of being mad and rude. Ok whatever

Finally... our bill came. It came up to $48.00 I was like da fuc I mean we got two drinks and two dishes... they add the tip automatically!! What the FUCK! NO! You're gonna earn your tip. I was really upset. $8.00 tip for bad customer service. No thank you. I left $40.00 and left. Biggest rip off ever.
