Of course we were drunk and extremely hungry and it was just the first spot that we ran into. I could have cared less about the "Coupons" being handed out by the pushy women out front. 

For drunk food this place is perfect. The greasy dim sum and crispy deep fried stuff is the best. 

We got one of the specials that was $15 or so bucks a person. (I cant remember exactly) We got some starters of Spring Roll, Bacon wrapped Green Onion & Prawns. Some type of Chicken on a stick that tasted like Maple Syrup, little Riblettes, and probably some other things I also cant remember. 

Then a tower of different selections of Dim Sum. Everything was varying and good. The best part was we were stuffed and sobering up. 

We also had some Tsingtao beer. Which tastes just like Budweiser by the way. 

The service was fast and efficient. I didn't come there expecting to become friends with anyone. 

I was expecting mediocre and guess what? I got exactly what I expected. You are definitely not going to get the royal treatment here so stop pretending like this place is more than you know it is.
author: Ivy R.

description: Found this restaurant as we were walking thru china town. We had nice experience with food and service. Food was very tasty and service was good.  The place was not the best looking restaurant but it's Chinatown so couldn't expect much.
author: Janet V.

description: please, please do not come here. horrible food and horrible service. pay attention to your check, they add the tip already but  its not required especially for the bad experience. it is a tourist trap. ruuuuuuun forrest ruuuun!!!
author: Charmaine E.

description:
absolutely horrible! Took forever to get our food. they actually served a portion of our order to the folks sitting at the table next to us.

After eating 2 apetizers and waiting for almost an hour we decided to get our bill and leave, they actually had the nerve to figure in a 20% tip as part of the bill!! You've got to be absolutely kidding me!

The food itself(what actually arrived at the table) wasnt all that bad, but the service and cheapness of the place left a very sour taste in my mouth. 

Never, ever again.
author: Mike F.

description:
JUST SAY NO!!! 
This place is the devil; from being literally escorted from walking around in Chinatown and were lured in with a brief glance at a page in menu (which happened to be the cheapest) we decided to go for it. The place was busy and seemed harmless. Mistake. Not checking the reviews before entering. Mistake #2.  The menu is 'family style', however, the portions are not family style size. As other reviews state this place is indeed over priced. They try and upsale the menu by offering rice, water, hot tea, ETC. we had to make it clear we did NOT want hot tea more than once. 
The service leaves a lot to be desired. At our table we asked for more lettuce cups for our lettuce wraps (which came with a meager 4 to begin with) that were never brought to our table. We waited 10+ minutes for the check. The icing on the cake was actually at the table behind us. A very calm, collected woman told her server she did not like a shrimp dish and asked for it to be taken from the table. In any other restaurant, this would have resulted in an apology from the server, an offer for anything instead of the dish, and it being taken off the bill. NOT HERE. The manager approached the table and argued with the woman about why she didn't like the dish. The shrimp didn't taste right- and honestly it doesn't matter what the reason is, the customer is always right. The manager said 'we don't like the way you say our shrimp is not fresh'-- not class or tact at all. After a heated manager told the woman that she was not going to take it off the bill or the table she put the dish down and walked away.  If I would have been the woman the end of the meal would not have been as poised. My girlfriend and I spoke to the women expressing our solidarity with her , asked for the check, waited and, left in a rush.  We didn't ask for free potstickers, mostly because we didn't trust the meat and didn't want to pay the 18% gratuity.  

Honestly, just don't go here. Food quality, cleanliness, and the inhospitable attitudes of the staff make this a total trap.
author: Taraneh K.

description:
This place was absolutely terrible. I was visiting from out of town (before I moved here) with a friend for work and we were lured by the balcony seating. Our biggest mistake was not checking yelp first.

-- The balcony was infested with pigeons and we ended up having to move inside when they swarmed.

-- I hate, HATE wasting food but the food was lukewarm, cringe worthy at very best, and I didn't eat it all because I was well convinced I would get a foodborne illness. Thankfully I didn't.

-- To boot it was way more expensive than it should have been.

Moral of the story, never. ever. ever. ever. go here.
author: Andrew P.

description:
We were just walking around town checking out the hype of Chinatown. When we got there it was a busy street filled with people, music, and lights! People were handing out fliers from random restaurants this was when we got suckered in to a coupon..  Free potstickers and ice cream with an entree purchase. 

When we entered the restaurant it was empty. Right then and there we should of left. But then we heard a little commotion coming from up stairs. With the coupon in hand and scrumptious looking pictures our curiosity won the battle. 

Oh boy were we in for a surprise. As we were looking at the menu we were stunned at the prices. Oh wait it gets better the pushy waiter walks by asking for our drink orders. We both ordered water but she was like, "Okay, tew dolla.." . I was shocked. So my boyfriend decided on hot tea instead since they were charging us anyways.. 

So we ordered two entrees; peppered beef and fried rice. Nothing special but oh here comes the best part we get our bill came out to $40! And they had the nerves to add their own tip!!  Yikes looks like we will never be back again!
author: Lena P.

description:
About a month ago, I visited this restaurant with my mother. I insisted on going to the Vietnamese restaurants (which are all definitely WAY better than this place) on that day, but she insisted "Oh but my friend thinks it's alright". She ate her words an hour later.

The sign reads 新杏香酒家(which roughly translates to "New Scent of Apricot Restaurant"), but I thought its name was 川味来客("Guest from Sichuan Cuisine" or something). From the outside, it looked fine; from the inside, it looked too cheap to be a 酒家; perhaps a cafeteria.

I don't remember much about the complimentary pot stickers, but I've definitely seen better.

Now, the main course-- I remember ordering noodles with meat sauce 炸酱面, and my mother water-boiled beef 水煮牛肉.

When we were at the restaurant, there were like two to three tables of customers. The wait time was a little bit long with few customers, but whatever.

My mother and I had expectations on Chinese dishes, especially on Sichuanese dishes(that's what we are):

The noodles(not Sichuanese) fell short on my standards: It felt way too wet. If you can hear the noodles making noise while you're mixing the ingredients, then it's not a good sign.

The beef(Sichuanese) was way worse: For some dish around $16, the proportions did not match the price(i.e. too small), and the dish itself was so heavily diluted that it's nowhere near spicy(at least in my opinion; my mother didn't even feel the spiciness). We can get better spicy beef out of another restaurant in Chinatown.

We only asked for take-out because it was wasteful to leave food like that. The waitress only gave boxes for us to pack(which is fine, but this will matter later).

Now this part I remember VERY vividly:

The tea was a sad joke. I'm aware that some restaurants offer complimentary tea while others do not, but we looked inside the teapot and the tea looked cheap. Still, we were charged $3... Just for the cheapest tea out there.

The green tea ice cream and fortune cookie... To me, the ice cream is very out of context because I've never seen a Chinese restaurant offer green tea ice cream as dessert; I would be fine if it's just a fortune cookie. Personally, I thought it was weird.

Oh, and the tipping. When we asked for the check, the waitress gave a check with the tip already written on there-- And it was pretty damn high for a low-standard restaurant like this. I mean, you expect to have such a high tip when you didn't even bother to pack the take-out for us? Really? So we caught it and asked the waitress to slash off the tip. (Afterwards, my mother bragged to her friends that she called off such a restaurant service.)

At the end of the day, we were two unhappy LOCALS treated like Chinese tourists. The Washington Cafe right across the street would've been a much better choice. Cheaper too(we spent about $55 in total).

Complimentary Wi-Fi doesn't help the restaurant much either; stay away from this restaurant, no matter how much those ladies on the street on Grant and Washington compel you to.
author: Derek T.

description: I was walking down the street and was handed a coupon for this restaurant. Now, I wasn't hungry, but I really had to pee, so I went in and ordered two green tea ice creams. When I got the bill it came out to $15 for two small ice creams! What the heck?
author: Sebastian C.

description:
So, this restaurant was suggested to my family by another business in CT.
When my family and I arrived at the doors, there was a young woman who greeted us and took us upstairs to our table.

We looked over the menus and decided upon a few dishes.  We ordered the broccoli beef, a vegetable dish, and a fried rice as well as plain rice. We also ordered a couple of appetizers and a few sodas.

I honestly didn't have high hopes for this restaurant, because it is a tourist trap.  However, I thought I'd give it a try anyway. Surprisingly everything we ordered was good. 

I know that at this point you're thinking..."how can anyone screw up a plate of vegetables and broccoli beef and fried rice?" Well, it has been done and I was extremely happy-shocked even that their beef  WAS NOT chewy (cheap meat) and over-gelatinous. The vegetable plate was also very pleasing as it had perfect balance in taste (not over-garlicky or too much sauce). The fried rice even tasted "clean" (not too greasy). The appetizers were tasty as well.

So, while I understand that some Yelp reviewers have complained about the price...I refuse to do the same. I do not mind paying more money for better quality. I will definitely dine in their facility again. And I never had an issue with a long wait. As a matter of fact we were in and out. It could have been, because I had a toddler in tow, but in any case the staff (yes plural, bc a few people tended to our table) was extremely helpful and polite. 


The free green tea ice cream at the end is also very nice.

Check it out for yourself!
author: Angela K.

description: 1 star for the wifi. The food was overpriced. Around 5 pieces of walnut shrimp entree for $20. And it was ok, nothing special. You can get it in other Chinese food restaurants. My sister and I were walking around Chinatown and a lady comes up to us trying to hand a coupon. We say no thanks and keep walking. Then another lady comes out of nowhere basically trying to drag us into the restaurant with the same coupons. It was already 9 and we were hungry so we just settled for it. You get free potstickers and ice cream with the coupon. But the catch is, you have to buy a pricier entree. You only get two small potstickers, and one tiny scoop of ice cream. The setting is weird because right when you walk in you have to walk up the stairs. The restaurant is on the second floor. The waitress was ok. We felt rushed and she came off very rude. I never got a refill on my water and was forced to drink from my sister's cup. She rushed to get the plates off our table but I wasn't done eating yet. The other two tables by us were complaining of how bad the service was as well. It's a good thing they were talking about it bc we were surprised when she brought our check and the tip was already written down as the "total price". They basically include the tip in the total for you but it is not required! The other table told us we can tell her that we only want the actual total charged not including the tip. I work for two restaurants so I know how customer service should be. When you tell the waitress that you only want the actual total charged, her fake smile goes away and says "why" in a very upset manner. Not even an apology or anything. The check comes back with an attitude. I will never recommend this place to anyone.
author: Charlene E.

description:
Overpriced MEDIOCRE Chinese food.  If I wanted bad Chinese I could have gone to Panda Express.  I should have known better eating at a random restaurant in Chinatown without checking Yelp, but I was starving and I walked into the first place I saw :(  First and last time I do that!  

The view from the balcony was nice though... so I guess if you don't mind eating bad food to have a nice view this is your place.
author: Jenn T.

description: Food was ok but they are sneaky and add a tip when they charge your card but don't tell you. Not cool! Luckily I saw on here from other people and caught it before we left them more of a tip.
author: Heather W.

description:
Sun Hung Heung hasn't been around for awhile. Gary Soup mentions 20 years.

spent some time here decades ago in the bar. learnt a dice game called : "captain, ship, and crew."  serious  money changed hands during these games.

had beginning' s luck.. afterwards just losses. gambling isn't/wasn't my cup of tea.
author: Victor G.

description: I wanted to take my family on a nice China town restaurant . This defiantly was not it !!! Service was horrible the waitress was rude and impatient , she kept pointing out the special of $19.95 a person when I said yeah I'm not interested in that she caught an attitude .  If that wasn't bad enough we waited for ever to get water . I had to get up and ask the lady , after asking the other lady 3 times . Food was horrible total bill was $140.which would have been fine if everything else didn't SUCK... They also included a 20% tip . Don't ever come here !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: George M.

description:
Worst food ever.
Added $5 tip themselves.
Promised a free parking and later was haggling for the tip to put a stamp on the parking ticket...rude staff. They are just bluffing people and trying to make quick money.
I didnt even pay a single penny as a tip.ridiculous behavior. Dont get carried over by the lady on street who gives you the menu and promises free parking.
author: Shweta P.

description: Taste like dog food, they pull you off the street with hopes of authentic food. Yet your stuck with a tourist trap of crap. Don't go here
author: Ryan M.

description:
We came here with the understanding that this was a tourist trap, and that the food probably wasn't going to be that great but we were tired, hungry, and just wanted a place to sit.

First off, the prices are way too high. $9 for a cold cucumber appetizer? I just bought an organic cucumber at Whole Foods for $2.49, so I don't' know where the other $7 in costs came from. Each dish was priced at least $12-13, which is ridiculous even in San Francisco (let's not forget that this is Chinatown where there is literally a restaurant every other doorway). 

I can't believe I'd ever say this, but I'd gladly take Panda Express over this place any day. None of the dishes looked or tasted very fresh, and weren't very aesthetically pleasing either. 

My one gripe with any restaurant is when they try to charge you on everything, from water to incorrect orders that were the restaurant's mistakes. Here, they charged for water, rice, and when they incorrectly brought out a thai iced tea instead of iced tea, we were charged for both on the bill.
author: Emily Z.

description:
Complete scam!!!! I ordered a $9.99 meal..and the bill ended up being $16.65 !!!! How???

They miscalculate tax and they add 20% tip automatically. Even after that the $16.65 amount didn't add up. 

So when I brought it to their notice. They started negotiating with me randomly and asked me if they can charge me $16 instead. 

I kept asking them why? And they kept lowering the bill price by $0.25 wherein I was embarrassed enough to just pay them $15 and leave!!


What a strange experience!!
author: Dipanker J.

description:
Wish I read the reviews before eating here!! Not the worst , but definitely not the best!! Had better Chinese food at panda express !! Food was Luke warm , service was just ok And even with coupons way to expensive for poor food and mediocre service!! 

Update!! Upon leaving we noticed the health report on wall , it said unsanitary kitchen and rat droppings on surfaces!! Really wtf !!
author: Chris G.

description:
Pos: potstickers & oranges free appetizers, ice cream scoop free at the end, food was fresh and authentic chinese, took restaurant.com coupon
Neg: Hidden fees, pressure to buy extras, 20% tip is included but not labeled as tip (so some may tip again), not many customers
author: Alex G.

description:
This place is a tourist trap. BE CAREFUL.  My daughter and I love walking around Chinatown and one of the places for lunch is Chinatown restaurant. So far we have had luck with the food. My regret is that it took me few visits to figure out that they were adding 20% tip to my check automatically. Only for serving two people and I will tip extra in cash! 
The visit I started asking questions about this 20% tip the waitress and the owner were very rude. They told that they add it as a suggestion. If the customer doesn't complain about it, they go ahead and charge it. Because I complained they had to make a new check without the additional charge. Unbelievable!
 I am absolutely sure most of their customers make the same mistake : tip twice at a very high rate. So the place is raking extra money for nothing. BAD. BAD. BAD.
author: Mako S.

description:
If I had an option of giving this "restaurant"  0 stars, I would. 

Service = Sucks
Food= Sucks
Free Pot stickers = Suck
Free ice cream = Sucks

And to top this off a tiny scoop of rice is $2!! Shouldn't that come with your nasty overpriced $10-$13 plate???

OH and to top it off, the tip for the service that you don't receive, comes included in your bill? Seriously? They don't even warn you, unless you add up your tab will you notice it under the tax line, a random charge. And if you want to do that then fine, give good customer service. We where ignored for 10 minutes to place our order and another 15 after the meal to get our tab. Hate this place and never coming back!
author: Mayra U.

description: This restaurant was extremely misleading. We got a coupon saying free potstickers, but we had to get multiple entrées to get the 4 pictured. Free parking? Nah. Gotta spend 35 bucks to get that validated. The waitress was rude and literally put her hand in my face to hush me when I had a question. Bad customer service.
author: Ruby H.

description:
OMG.. YELPP!!! Please make a NO STAR button!!!! This place is HUMILIATING to chinese people!!!  (Im chinese!) My friend and I wanted to feel like a tourist in our own city last week and decided to try this place JUST FOR THE BALCONY SEATING. LOL. We're both HUGE Yelpers and we don't know why we didn't check the reviews before walking in. LOL. Anyways, let me list down the negatives about this restaurant, since there isnt ONE SINGLE positive. 
 
1) The balcony might look awesome.. but it feels like it can collapse any second as you're sitting there.
2) Servers... WHERE ARE YOU GUYS?!!?
3) Services.. this word does not exist in their dictionary apparently. 
4) Food... um.. someone got food poisoning about a week ago..food inspectors... WHERE ARE YOU GUYS?? The food tasted like left over food from days ago...
5) Bill.. um... 2 people...GRATUITY?? I cant wait till this restaurant gets SUED! (When we asked why... they stated that THEY WERE BUSY???) Uh.. no you weren't.
6) DONT STAND THERE AND WATCH US PAY FOR OUR BILL!  THAT IS SUPER RUDE. WOULD YOU LIKE TO HAVE A SEAT WHILE WE'RE PAYING??? Oh , AND WHY DONT YOU SIP ON YOUR NASTY ICED COFFEE WHILE YOURE AT IT. 

RIDICULOUS.
author: Annie Y.

description: Im Asian and this PLACE is the WORST Asian RESTAURANT I've been to ever!!! I rarely write bad reviews but this one really deserves it! Prices on the flyer did not reflect the prices that were on the menu when we sat down and it took almost an hour to get our food (we had to ask for our food, wtf). Plus tip was automatically added to our overpriced bill. We took the tip off real quick because customer service was horrible. Wish I can can give them -4 stars! Please don't eat here, you'll thank me!!
author: Khan I.

description: Worst restaurant I have ever been. The food is so expensive and they overcharges on the bill. The food portion is tiny. When dishes come,  there were only half plate. Where the hack did the other half portion go? Moreover, We waited so long for our six dishes and there were only five dished made to the table at the end. So do not eat there. You will be so disappointed.
author: Summer Jia L.

description:
Awful place !

The food was not good,and overpriced.  
Waiters was not very polity and the serve was extremely slow!
We didn't say anything until we saw the bill! 
They added tips to our bill!!!
When we complained to the manager, the manager was so arrogant!  

I'll tell my friends this terrible place, and never go there anymore.
author: Kimi Y.

description:
DON'T COME HERE!! 

Don't be fooled by the awesome balcony seating. This place is a scam.

The food is disgusting & overpriced 
Servers are rude & take forever 
They included "tip" for 2 people, and when I asked her why.. She said "cause today is busy" wow.

Walk down the block and don't pay $5 for a plate of dimsum

They seriously made this place to lure in tourists.. Stay awaaaayyyy
author: Cara N.

description:
I wish I could give this 0 stars.

Yes, it's touristy. We knew that going in, but we wanted a place to eat lunch and the balcony looked appealing. What a terrible decision we made.

The food was average at best, but as other reviewers point out, they do sketchy things with the bill. We had a coupon for free potstickers (which was NOT honored) and, besides that we ordered two entrees of General Tso's chicken, one white rice, and one fried rice. We drank water. Our bill -- which was written in Chinese and not itemized -- was close to $60!  The tip was already included, yet there was a tip line on the receipt. They were unwilling to correct the bill.

To add insult, when it came time to leave, I forgot that there was a large step down into the restaurant from the balcony. There was no sign or marking on the floor -- instead I just bit it into the upstairs dining area. No one from the restaurant came to check to see if I was okay. Either they were deaf or used to this happening. Thankfully I'm not geriatric-aged and, although my wrist still is sore a week later, I didn't break anything.

I hope this place gets shut down immediately. Do yourself a favor and do NOT go there!
author: Sarah F.

description:
This is the Worst restaurant I have ever been for years!!! Food is terrible, portion is tiny, service is rude... Rice is uncooked and u have to pay for it???? Wtf 

People don't go to the restaurant!!!
author: Linqing L.

description:
NO STARS IF POSSIBLE. 

DO NOT GO HERE. 

I have not posted a review in years but a recent dinner at this restaurant compelled me to write this. The warning signs were all there from the beginning. But sometimes we make dumb choices when pressed for time don't we?

-Service? What's that? Asking people to wait on the stairs for a table. Slamming the menu down on the table. 

-Dirty plates. Dirty napkins. Thank god the chop sticks were for one time use. 

-Added a 15% (rounded up closer to 16%) tip for TWO people. Unfortunately, I saw the warnings on Yelp after I got my check. 

-Added a few extra dollars to the subtotal. Too large and odd of an amount to be a simple mistake. 

-Tea is $3. This may not bother some people but it added to my annoyance of the place. 

This restaurant is an embarrassment to Chinatown. An embarrassment to San Francisco. I'm almost embarrassed to be Chinese after dining here.
author: David C.

description: I used to go here once a week the staff knew me well. They seem to have recently changed the entire staff many new faces. One server walked behind with a tray and struck me in the back of my head while ibwas sitting. He didn't even say anything mainly he had the annoyed look at me.  Wow I must say even the portions drastically got reduced by 30%. This place has lost my business
author: Kevin G.

description:
Only gave them one star because there is no option to give "no" stars.

Shame on me for not reading the Yelp comments before going in - we had about the same experience as most of the "1 star" ratings.

In a nutshell:

* Got suckered in by the hawkers on the sidewalk
* Waiter was impatient taking our order - that should have been the first clue - double shame on me.
* Wonton soup was BLAND - seriously tasted like bathwater & old chicken
* Fun beef something or other noodle dish was BLAND and cold
* both dishes served at same time, good luck eating both before they get cold

I tried to call our waitress - she refused to come to our table.

Second waitress referred us back to the 1st waitress

I called for one young man who walked by and he blew us off - I raised my voice and said, "Does anyone work here?" I told him the food was bland and requested some chili - he stormed off and began talking rudely about us to the manager. Manager comes over and tells us that it is our fault the food is bland, we should have requested that they add spices to the food. The young man adds, "This is authentic Chinese food, it is supposed to taste like this"

Do you hear that Chinese people? Your food is SUPPOSED TO TASTE BLAND.

Yeah, and I was born yesterday.

Table next to us, 6 from Denmark got "screwed" on the "tip double charge" and couldn't even understand their bill (all bills are written in Chinese).

At 21:45, a waitress came by and dropped the bill on the table, left some "free ice cream" and began clearing our soy sauce & other condiments. They did this at each table and it was obvious that they wanted everyone out by 2200 so that they could go home. A lady came out and started vacuum cleaning next to our table.

Staff was rude, food was bland and then when we tried to leave we found we were locked in and couldn't get out.

I'll NEVER go into any business again until I've checked Yelp.

Do yourself a favor and AVOID THIS HORRIBLE BUSINESS!!!
author: Scott G.

description:
Like many others before me, I was lured in to this sh**hole by flyers. Despite this place looking extremely oriental, the food here is terrible.

I came here with my gf hoping for a  decent place to eat, with at least decent price. The terrible service is expected because it's an asian place. It turned out to be worst.

Here is why

*They completely forgot to take out orders 
*They charged us $3.00 for a bottle of arrowhead after we asked for "water"
*The coconut cocktail has a weird detergent scent to it which means it is going bad
* None of the food was authentic Chinese food. it was not even fresh...
* One of the waitress was b**tching that we leave  our plates too close to the edge of the balcony

The bill came out to be like $50 for two person. We did not even finish half of it because the food was so stale. The only worth taking home was the bottle of arrowhead.
author: Loc N.

description: The absolute worst service followed by a mediocre meal. And topped off with a ridiculously over priced bill. Seriously, what place still charges for refills? I wish would have read the reviews before walking in. STAY AWAY!
author: Frankie C.

description:
I came here from Las Vegas, we were going to check reviews, but then got lazy lol here are a few things I have to say:

1. they serve "dim sum" all day, but it's not pushed around in carts, but made to order. 
2. the service was just okay; it was slow for a small amount of people

3. the food didnt taste foreign or authentic at all. that's what surprised me the most; it tasted American. also, it wasn't very good--tastes like there is an inexperienced cook in the kitchen. 

Ive been to a lot of Chinatowns, I'm not even Chinese, but this is sad that it wasn't authentic. 

So skip this place, please. it's not worth your time. even if you're tired and need to sit down from walking too much--it's not worth it! We got pulled in by flyers, but regretted it after.
author: Raven-Joie R.

description:
AAARRRGGHH!  Should have gotten off my butt and checked the yelp rating of this place before walking in....place is run by a bunch of grifters.  Waitress wanted to charge me for water.
Billed me for food I didn't order and then refused to take the food back, and, why should she?  She already added a 20% tip for herself onto our lunch for a party of two.  I had to go to the manager to get that knocked off.  They pass out coupons stating "20% + free potstickers" and then refused to give the 20% off of the bill claiming it was an "either/or" coupon, and they had already given me 4 greasy complimentary potstickers.
This restaurant was the ONLY BAD PART about our day in Chinatown.
author: Laura S.

description:
I was a sucker that got pulled in via the flyers. The food was ok. Nothing special. I just felt like a chump after I read all the reviews. I should've known better!

I'd say, walk around and find better Chinese food. The staff really tries to rush people in as soon as possible.
author: Ryan L.

description: One of the worst meals of my life. Horrible food, exceptionally bad service and the staff was amazingly rude. Never ever go there!
author: Akanksha R.

description:
Why didn't we check Yelp before entering this place?

Once we sat down already at the table we realized the poor reviews on Yelp, so we decided to only order a couple of dishes and order more food later if we liked our two dishes. The waitress was kind of rude by our decision to eat a couple of dishes of dim sum and wait. She insisted that we could not keep the menu with us, but just ask again for the menu when we were ready to order. Clearly they wanted us to order all the food first without sampling any of their food. 

The food really is not great here. Our first two dishes consisted of the lucky fish dumplings and smoky tea duck. The lucky fish dumplings were dry and not tasty. Now I'm a big duck fan, so to be disappointed by their smoky tea duck is a big deal for me. It was really dry too. Overall, we were quite disappointed by the quality of the poor food and rude service.As you can imagine, we did not order any more dishes and we will definitely not be back.
author: Jerod Y.

description:
Warning. We were sucked in by thr flyer. When we got to the restruant and saw the two flights of stairs I was in no mood. Recovering from knee surgery and was already hurting from walking all day. The young girl about carried me up the stairs. I get it she wanted the business.  

The place was not busy and the service was extremely slow considering how few tables they had to wait on. We both ordered ice tea.  We got the free potsticker. They were good. Only 4 but they were free. Then we got spring rolls (4) but what they brought us was egg rolls (fried) not exactly what we were expecting to get. The egg rolls were ok. Lack filling and very greasy. We then ordered a regular order of fried rice and a regular order of Kung Poa Chicken.  The regular portions were very large and more than enough to share. Both the fried rice and Kung Pao Chicken were very good. We have food leftover. We then got a refill of tea and now she actually brought out a craft of tea.  We also got a fortune cookie and some green ice cream that was very good and free.

I gave them two stars because the service was terrible and the bill. OMG. Lets see they had the fried rice 8.50 the chicken 11.50 and spring rolls 4.50 but for drinks it had $10.00 yep that's right. She said ice tea is 2.50 a glass no free refills and she said I even gave you extra with the craft with yiur second glass of tea.  REALLY!!!! Shocker!  Then she got mad that we questioned the bill and walked off. we then called her over again because there was a added fee of $5.95 when we asked what that was for she said they added the tip. We said I don't think so. We told them we would decide how much of a tip we leave them.  Bathrooms smelled real bad so beware. Staff is just pushy and rude.
author: Theresa B.

description: I would not put any stars if possible. The food is lousy but more importantly they blatantly tried to rip me off.  My husband and I got sucked into going there as we were looking for another old time restaurant that is no longer around.  Right off I noticed that the prices were high.  We ordered the dinner for 2 at $21.00 each.  My husband got tea for $4.00.  When the bill arrived the total was $49.10.  At the bottom there was something else written that said $58.00.  They processed my card for $58.00.  I asked a young waiter why I was charged $58.00 and he said it was the tip.  I asked him where on the menu did it state a 20% tip is added after tax for a party of 2.  Of course he could not find it.  A more senior waitress came over and said oh, it is for drinks (that' we did not have).  Rest assured I think this restaurant should be closed down immediately.  I will spread the word.
author: H. D.

description:
Ok I dont know what everyone is praising here... 

First off they attack you in the street... super hustling for people to come in their restaurant... They give you free pot stickers... that were delish... but I would rather you just let me find your place and not have to feel like you NEED me to come in there and drag me up the stairs to eat.

The food... oh man the food!!! So the free pot stickers were mediocre, the fried rice lacked moisture and flavor, the chicken was BLOODY and the pork chops were probably the best thing we had... but there were like 5 little pieces for damn near $10.00. 

Safe to say I will NEVER eat there even if they comped my meal!!! I appreciated the seating on the balcony but it wasn't enough to up this review or make me want to return!!!
author: Adeile A.

description: DONT GO HERE!!!! I advise you guys not to come here, they use a worker outside to persuade tourists to go in the restaurant, we was iffy about going and was about to check yelp but the lady keep saying a lot of customers and this is a good place, so we went in the set up of the restaurant was not bad but when the food come out it was horrible the portion was barely enough to feed a 5 year old, and what really pissed me off was THEY ADDED 20% TIPS ON THEIR OWN, and they service was horrible.
author: Toby H.

description: Service was fine. Food was really good. Didn't experience all the drama of others. I'd come back.
author: Mike G.

description: Worst place ever add items to my bill that we did not consume no one could explain what they are it was awful!!
author: Libertad A.

description:
Man.. I'm yelp elite, and I got sucked into this place like no other.

Awful. Food was meh. It was open on the street we were walking on.  Even after a few cocktails and our tastebuds were not as sophisticated, this food was awful. I would not recommend coming here, and definitely move along.
author: Natalie G.

description:
WARNING! PLEASE READ BEFORE YOU GO HERE!!!
Here's how you do this place, you use it, you don't let them use you!
yes, it's tourist trap (since 1919) with them now trying to get you in the place with free potstickers but don't fall for their trap - same as if you were traveling the backstreets of china, you have to be sly and cunning and savvy to do this place right - or you will be taken for your dollars.
the secret to this place is (and there are a few other old gems in chinatown to discover) to get a seat on their second story outdoor balcony on a sunny afternoon, order a couple brews ($4) and maybe one dish (pick a cheap one, as the food is overpriced for what you get) then enjoy yourself watching chinatown from above.
a nice spot to kick back on a sunny afternoon or warm evening.
that's the secret to this chinatown spot.
p.s. - they will still charge for tips and check the check and don't be afraid to haggle and challenge them, - it's chinatown after all !
p.s.s - if you can't get a seat on the balcony wait, or get out of there and go across the street for cheaper similar food.
author: Misa A.

description:
Hated our experience here.  We took the family to San Fran for spring break and while in China town were eagerly greeted by their staff to try their restaurant.  I should have checked Yelp first.

The food was mediocre at best.  The service was slow and our waitress seemed bothered by every request.  There were 6 of us an they put us at a table for 4 I asked to be moved and they seemed totally put out.

I felt like cattle being rushed in to the slaughter house.  We quickly got in but took forever to get out and will not go back
author: Dave W.

description: The restaurant was very busy but service was good. Food was properly cooked. Service and food were fine. Nothing fancy but not as horrible as the reviews I read.
author: Preeti M.

description: Horrible. Menu said $14/4. Buy instead it was $14 for four diff people. Not as a package just $14 for all 4.. Total rip off. Never again
author: Jeffrey H.

description: This was the worst restaurant I have ever eaten at. They charged us the 18% tip because we were 5 people counting in a toddler that didn't eat. Food was horrible. This restaurant does not even deserve one star
author: Yvonne G.

description:
It seems the majority of the reviewers for this restaurant were lured in by the smiling, friendly people on the streets giving them a coupon good for one order or pot stickers and some ice cream.  Yep, we joined the club too.  We had planned on going to a restaurant recommended in our Frommer's Guide Book but could not find it when we met up with the hawkers on the street who convinced us to go inside.  They were kind of like the Sirens that lured the sailors to their deaths in the ancient world, only this time they were resplendent with lively apparel and giving out promises of good food to come.  

We were taken upstairs to the dining area and given a menu, expecting that we would have dim sum as promised by the street people.  The dim sum was on a menu that you had to order rather than on cars pushed around by friendly staff as at other places.  We should have taken to the streets and gotten away while we could but we gave in to the seductive suggestions.  We ordered ice tea ($2.50 for a single glass, no refills we learned the hard way).  Then we each ordered an entree, both of which were not terrible but not exactly great either.  

The capper of the experience came when we received our bill and found out they had added their own 15% tip when we had planned on giving much less because the service was incredibly slow and the servers avoided us like the plague whenever we needed anything.  I asked the server what that was for and she just muttered, "15%" went the other way.  I started to cause a scene and refuse to pay it but decided to just be nice and learn from this experience.  

So, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED....when friendly smiling people offer you a coupon in Chinatown...run away fast...and find another place, any place to try.  This one is not worth the emotional effort.
author: Jerry C.

description:
DO NOT EVER GO TO THIS RESTAURANT! 

If you're a TOURIST here in SF, look elsewhere besides here, and don't let the fliers get to you. It's no wonder there's a woman on each corner passing out fliers.

We were the only asians up in the restaurant. We were treated poorly. The service was horrible. We were the first 3 customers seated down, yet somehow, the 4 customers that came before us had all their food and drinks served before us. Wtf?

The food was another story on its own. It was either undercooked, overcooked, or had a piece of pube hair on it,. I have a picture to prove it. My sticky rice was not even sticky. It wasn't cooked long enough. Instead of making me another one, they went a nuked it instead. My turnip was rubbery. My shrimp dumplings was undercooked.

Worst part is, when I went to complain to the manager, she didn't apologize. What did she do? She got defensive and said "Well, that's weird because no one else is complaining?!!!!" Are you kidding me!!!? There's someone's HAIR on my FOOD. You NUKED undercooked food, and used days old meat....

Staying in there for less than half an hour, my meal came out to be $64. Never again. Not even an apology.

PLEASE YELP THIS PLACE before going in. If I could, I give this place NO STARS. Worst food and service EVER!
author: Leena N.

description:
OK so many people here say this place is horrible. I assure you it isn't! The food was decent, the prices were ok also. 

I didn't like the fact that they put the tip on the charge...a little bit presumptuous really...but overall it was ok...not amazing but ok.
author: Vlad W.

description: I have to agree with all the bad reviews. Its not that the food was that bad, but the check came out to be about $35 per person and we hardly ordered anything. The rice was hard and stale. I had them take it away and come back with new rice and it was still hard and stale and they still charged us for the rice. Anything that is not on the menu is ridiculously expensive. I think the beer I had was $12. There are so many good places in Chinatown I will never come here again. I have to say this is an ultimate tourist trap. No locals eat here.
author: Ian W.

description: Took a chance without checking Yelp, bad idea!!! Overpriced and barely passable food. Bland and boring. There are so many better places to eat in Chinatown such as Snow Garden or House of Nanking.
author: Richelle N.

description:
I wouldn't eat this food again... even if it were free. A "restaurant" of such low quality  wouldn't be able to survive if not for the steady stream of  naive tourist (& impulsive SF residents that don't yelp before they act) fueling it.

They must be some sort of aliens with china-men and china-women costumes. hahaha.  Even if they were aliens, shouldn't they know how to cook Chinese food since they're from china. isn't everything made in china?! dammit. someone lied.

1. Impostorous, oily, not fresh, disappointing, fail Chinese food
2. good service (who wouldn't be happy ripping off tourist with ease) 
3. bad parking
4. weird tasting soy sauce
5. grimy.
6. good green tea ice cream
7. impostorous fortune cookie 
8. good hot tea ($2) 
9. not a good way to spend your red envelope money
10. the best way to ruin Chinese new years yup. 
11. $43 for food I wouldn't even eat for free
12. dammit
author: Katherine F.

description: What can I say.  We didn't read the reviews before we went in.  :(. My daughter had tow get water twice and both times there was something in her water.  The food was very greasy.
author: J Z.

description:
Good food.. Bad service! Over charged us for everything! 
Have the food, check the bill twice! Ughh
author: Carmen I.

description:
The restaurant is nice when you first come in, but it is DISGUSTING. 

There was a cockroach on the floor right next to my table.. The water tasted like gas... And it took forever to get our food. 

Eventually we received some food which was not ours and they denied their mistake. It took forever but ended up getting us most of our order. After we finished eating the poorly cooked food my group and I asked for our check and received the tab for the large party that were next to us.  Again we were accused of being wrong and that it was our order and they refused to give us the right check.  Our check should've been 30 dollars at the most but we ended up paying 80 dollars.

The food was gross, the service was rude, and the food was not worth it's price by a long shot.

Please don't let your hungry bellies take you into this awful restaurant like my friends and I had.
author: Angelina R.

description: I  ordered the DimSum, so can't comment on the other offerings, but would not return here.  Service was slow, food was very average, just so many other choices nearby.  Should have known when they were handing out coupons on the street.
author: Richard B.

description: Don't ever never come to this restaurant ! My husband and I were there around 9pm and order two dishes, a bowl of soup and a soda, we waited around 30 minutes for the food to come out! Very small portion and bad taste and cost us 68 dollars. So so regret to step in to this restaurant, the worst restaurant I have been!
author: Michelle C.

description: If I could give negative stars I would. I have been here many times and take out of town friends here when they visit San Francisco. My Russian family came to visit me and they never had Chinese food before. I thought this would be a perfect place once again until half way through the meal a giant American Cock Roach poked his head out of the rice. The server said she just opened a window and it flew in and I balked at her since I have people that I know in the pest control industry. This is a roach caused by filthy conditions within the restaurant. One of the employees chased the roach and finally killed it. Everyone at my table walked out of the restaurant and we refused to pay. There was nothing this establishment could do because they were so in the wrong and lucky I don't sue them or call the health department.
author: Davidson H.

description:
Wow, everyone is hating on this place! I didn't think it was great but it also wasn't terrible. My dad and I were in chinatown and were going to go to one of his favorite restaurants but it turned out they didn't take credit cards. As we walked down the street looking for an ATM we passed this place and my tapeworm and I convinced him we should just eat here.

Um, the stairway to heaven up to the dining room was crazy steep .. but I guess that's not enough to hate this place for. The food was okay, I thought the service was comparable for a not-fancy asian restaurant (smile? what's that?), and I didn't have a chance to see the bill so not sure if it was expensive or not.

Food: Okay
Service: Okay
Ambiance: Meh - not the prettiest restaurant by any means
Value: Okay

I'm not opposed to coming here again but I wouldn't seek this place out. Two things I thought were nice 1 - you got 4 free potstickers when you were seated, 2 - you got a little scoop of green tea ice cream for free after your meal. (In a togo cup w/spoon)
author: Monika C.

description:
Careful with the killer pigeons!!!

Not a joke. We were passing by when a beer bottle fell from this restaurant's second floor onto the sidewalk. They apologized and said it was a pigeon (*.*)

I agree with all other comments here, there are many other options in Chinatown to just fall for this tourist trap. 

It may lure you with its more westernized (readable) menu, but you are better off with many other traditional Chinese spots close by.

If you want an easy to read menu paired with excellent food, walk another block to R and G Lounge in Kearny.
author: Leopoldo P.

description: WORST restaurant ever. Food was disgusting and overpriced. Service was shockingly rude.
author: Ziwei Z.

description:
I am a Chinese and eat dim a lot.
This is the worst Chinese restaurant where I have ever been.
After seated, no water, no tea, no plate, no chopstick...
Ordered 12 dimsums, waited for 30 mins to get the 1 (Yea, just one) dimsum on the table, and it is cold.. WTH. Because its too slow and we are hungry, so we decided to pay and leave, so we asked for bill and waited for another 30 mins to get the bill.

Service -  very bad!

Food -  very bad!
author: Ken T.

description: $15.95/ person for the din-sum was not worth it. Service was slow.  Ordered a coke and they handed me a can -___-  food was okay.
author: Nicole B.

description: We had dinner here last Sunday.  We were hungry so chose this restaurant because some gal in the street told us it was great.  Well it needs lots of work.  My husband ordered a beer and didn't get a glass.  We asked three waitresses for a glass and finally one arrived - warm from the dishwasher.  Food was just okay.  Dishes came out slowly and my main dish of Sea Bass was so late that we were full by then.  The décor was shabby.  They did indeed add a big tip and it wasn't so noticeable such that if you don't read the small print you might miss that fact and add another tip which they just don't deserve.  Surprised this place is still open.  Glad I didn't see the kitchen if you know what I mean.
author: Wendy B.

description:
DO NOT come here...big fake...Ad say 40$/ 4people but turn out 68$ total...Lier...
Food is super bad also...It's so weird...If someone ate before, they would realize that..

Unfortunately, after me, I see a lot people going after...
Just going to somewhere the most Chinese go to...

Don't get cheated by the lady in corner of the street..." DIM SUM...DIM SUM... is good for you".... --- Which "May" good for you, but hurt you wallet. :))
author: Thanh N.

description: Words can't describe how bad i felt after dinning at this place, the food was very mediocre and service was lousy, on top of that it was expensive. Stay away from those street flyers!!! Yes seriously!!!
author: Pang L.

description:
Oh my! Watch out, stay away, read the reviews!! And believe they are true!!!!!!

We had fallen into the same trap as the others, lady gave us a coupon and walked us all the way tot the restaurant. It was a bit shady looking when we went in and we peeked at the reviews when we sat down, but we decided to give it a try. We ordered a dish (I forget the name, but it is some kind of sampler). It said it was $10. Not true. And the food was terrible!

We got our free pot stickers which were overcooked. There was some sort of bar-b-que bread balls which were like dog food. Very gross. We ended up eating only 1/4 of the food we ordered and decided to leave.

Our bill (which we had to chase up for 10 mins) was $40!!! This was just an order of appetizers. What they don't tell you is they charge per person (not on the menu either) and you can't just order for one person.

Stay away my friend, waste of your time and $.
author: Jade S.

description: Gave me a beer to drink and then told me it was a ten dollar minimum. Not a nice thing to do. It was almost closing so they just charged me 10 for a beer. That's it. I just left.
author: Scott V.

description:
Felt like a tourist trap but we were just killing time before the flight home so went for it anyway. Pleasant surprise, food was okay, nobody tried to rip us off, service was just fine. 

Had some dim sums (about $5 per portion) and fried rice, everyone liked what they had. Good value for money, but nothing spectacular.
author: Mikko U.

description:
Food was just like any American Chinese restaurant. Think Panda Express. They forgot my companions dish, so I ate mine cold. No apology, no explanation. 

They had a 20% off coupon for select dishes but applies to only one dish. 

I was hoping for authentic. Maybe next trip.
author: Albert B.

description:
A tourist trap and a bad one at that. The complimentary potstickers are probably frozen ones cooked at a batch and microwaved before serving. The szechuan menus are unauthentic and looks different from the pictures. $3 for mass produced cheap tea is a joke. The profit margin for that is probably $2.99. And the tip is added because they probably know they won't get any.

The best part of the meal was the green tea ice cream which is probably Costco's.

I have been annoyed by crappy service in Chinese restaurants before. But I rarely have been angry at a Chinese restaurant for bad food, bad service, and expensive price. This place has blown me away.
author: Peter H.

description:
Here is my story with this restaurant. I am a Chinese by the way. My wife and I were looking for a restaurant that could validate my parking ticket, and monday lunch, so we were walking around. Walked into a few restaurants that we want to dine in but none of them validate our ticket. So here it comes this restaurant. Talked to the lady on the street and they said they validate tickets when we dine in, so we went in. When I got into the restaurant, I saw no Chinese diner there (which is an extremely bad signal in a GOOD Chinese food restaurant just FYI), but you know what, forget about it, I am hungry. So we sat down, looked at the menu, extremely pricy. So I was like, since they validate my ticket, our menu should only be around $20, SURE we will just order 2 noodle and just get out. Food came, crappy of course. 

What pissed me the most was that, when I was asking them to validate my ticket, they told me that we have to order more than $30 food in order for them to validate the ticket, charged us $5 extra on beverages (1 can of coke and tea). Needless to say, I will never go there again and I will be actively tell all the people around me not to go there ever.
author: Stephen T.

description:
This review is for their UNETHICAL way of doing business. When we asked for drinking water, they brought us bottled water without noticing beforehand, and charged $2 for each bottle. Worse, they automatically included 18% tip WITHOUT explaining anything. Only when we asked about the extra amount on the bill did they said it was for the tip! 

Avoid this restaurant.
author: Nga N.

description:
HORRIBLE!!! GOT SICK FROM THIS PLACE!!!
I was visiting and got lured in off the street. My partner and I had a long day and wanted to finally eat Chinese food in "Chinatown" before catching our flight home. 
This place was a TOTAL SCAM!!! 
Food was somewhat palpable. 
When I got the bill they added the gratuity. When I asked why my bill didn't add up correctly the waitress said the tip was added on. I never heard of this for a tab for 2 people. That was annoying...

Shortly after our meal both my partner and I started to feel very sick! Nauseous and the worst stomachache. Believe me having to get on a plane feeling like this was the worst! We looked up our symptoms and thought maybe it was due to MSG! I read that the symptoms we felt coyly have been a result from ingesting MSG. 
After the whole experience I DO NOT Recommend this place!!!!
author: Rick R.

description: TERRIBLE!!!! Worst experience ever!!! They lure tourists in with the attraction of free ice cream, the restaurant's only saving grace. They served the beer warm and with no ice, and they include the tip within the bill, which is written in Mandarin. Do not go to this place .. The plates have little to no presentation and the meat is gummy and weird!! Do not go to this place!!! Any restaurant along Chinatown would be a better choice than this place..
author: Yuni N.

description:
In the midst of all the negative reviews - my wife and I gave this place a try because we wanted to explore. Sure there are these ladies on the street trying to lure people in to eat at their restaurant, and in all honesty I ignore them like some begger asking for change. 
Anyway on to the food -
We liked it. Yes it is pricey - at least a good 2.00 more than the average Chinese restaurant. We did eat upstairs and there were a lot of people so I thought this was a good sign. You do get free Potstickers and they were small but were really yummy. 
We ordered some dim sum dishes and liked them a lot. Fresh, hot dumplings .. yum city. We got the steamed pork dumplings and Siu Mai . good stuff. 
We also ordered combination fried rice which was really good and General Tsos chicken. I never saw it presented like this - longer pieces of chicken as opposed to th usual Mcnugget looking chicken. It was a smaller portion but with the other items we ordered it was fine. Even the free green tea ice cream and fortune cookie was pretty cool. For the price you do get FREE food 
The tip was already presented on the bill which was interesting. I think places are going to be doing that in the future. 
No we did not see any fruit flies in any of our food and we did not get sick from eating there, in fact it was a very pleasant digestive feeling. We'd go again, although after reading all the reviews, Id be scared to. I guess we lucked out..or maybe they got their act together. 
The bathroom is downstairs so its probably better to use it before you go upstairs unless you want some exercise.
author: David S.

description: This was the worst food and the worst service i have ever had. Do not fall for the flyers or the misleading reviews
author: Blaine B.

description:
If you're here because of a coupon. LEAVE NOW. It's only applicable if you order one of their overpriced entrées. 

If you're seated, LEAVE NOW!! The manager is really rude and pushy. Believe the yelp ratings. 

My friends and I were told to never go back there by the manager because we wanted to cancel our orders. Something we didn't need to be told. 

Horrible place that uses coupons to trap unwarranted customers.
author: Lih Seng G.

description: If I can give it no stars I would. Food is really bad, service mediocre. Would not recommend anyone to come for sure!
author: Jun-Han S.

description:
Seriously over priced !!!and the staff is RUDE! 
We had a small problem with my friends order, she did not like what she ordered and she had only taken one bite of it. When we told the waitress that she didn't like it , the waitress told us there was nothing she can do about it , she said that she saw us talking and laughing ( she said, Her actual words, you are here blah blah blah and ja ja ja and you don't like the food) from my understanding she believed that because we were talking and laughing with one another that we loved the food. We tried to explain that since she never came back to ask if everything was fine we had to wave her down for her to come back, so that's why we couldn't let her know earlier that the food was bad. She apparently did not like what we had said and was speaking to us in a rude tone. She said this is china town we don't have to please the customer. 

Well we were shocked from her reaction and response. We asked for the check and they immediately saw we were upset and they send a different waitress. They offered us desert for free but seriously after that , no way ! were we going to stay even if it was for free. We ended up paying for an over priced dinner and got the worst service ever. I have been a waitress for 5 years and I've had difficult customers but never to the point to be so rude to them. Well I guess it was our mistake bc as the waitress said this is Chinatown!
author: Cindy M.

description:
I was really surprised to see such a low rating. I've eaten here several times before and always thought the food was good.
Yes, the girls outside on the corner can be annoying and you end up with about 5 coupons for free pot stickers; but that never really bothered me.

I had a restaurant.com coupon and already knew we were going to eat here for lunch. Being it was Chinese New Year, the place was PACKED!! We only had to wait for about 5 minutes before we got seated, so not bad. They have a good menu with lots of variety and several pre-fix family meals. We opted for one of those as there were 4 of us. Plenty of food to go around and we even had a few leftovers. The food itself was good. Pepper beef had a good flavor. The creamy prawns with walnuts is a must! The seafood veggie was a little bland but mixing with the general tao chicken helped give it some added flavor.

They took both my coupons, so we got the free pot stickers and green tea ice cream for free. They also took off the 10 for the other coupon; but the bill was still really confusing.
There was an extra $14 tacked on. Was this for the tip? Then there was a circled about at $16 that said tip. The original bill came to $131 but then a big $120 in sharpie. WHAT? The table next to us must have overheard because they mentioned they had an odd tip charge as well... are they trying to charge the tip twice? I think so and also think not!

Well, we left them with $120 as that's what was appropriate for the meal with coupon and tip.

How unfortunate for this. If I can remember correctly, the last time we were there, there was a weird issue with the bill too; but it seemed so minor.
This time I will not forget, especially after seeing all these bad reviews.

With all the other choices out there to eat I really need to find another place that isn't so touristy. 

Overall, the food was good. Service was just okay, even if they aren't so busy, it's so-so. That tipping twice on the bill not so cool.
author: Sandra R.

description: I'm not eating here again. Their dim sum is hard (not fresh) and the restaurant is expensive!  They automatically add gratuity for 2 ppl.
author: GeeDee G.

description: The foods good, service could be a bit fast and it can be a tad pricey but not bad enough to stay away.  They validate parking if tab is $30+, so fat belly, cheap or free parking equals win/win.
author: Drake B.

description:
I didn't Yelp this place before coming --- my ultimate downfall.

So I had met up with my friend in Chinatown [since I was visiting my grandparents who lives around there] and we were looking for a place to grab some lunch.  We were about to head into a bakery/cafe when this forceful lady shoved a flier at us and literally dragged us towards the front of the restaurant.  Being the slightly scared and famished people we were, we heeded her pushiness and ran up the stairs.  And that's when it went down hill.

The food, to put it bluntly, sucked.  It was over-priced, disgusting, MSG-infested, and cold.  Not only were they rude to my friend, who's Caucasian, they decided to play that B.S. card where they "only spoke Chinese" --- even though the restaurant was filled with non-Chinese people!  When I spoke up in Cantonese for some water [they brought me my Thai Iced Tea with nothing else], the waiter just glared at me and poured water into my still-slightly-filled tea.  GROSS!  RUDE!

I would never ever recommend this place to anyone.  You're better off eating at one of the scary hole-in-the-wall restaurants.
author: Joyce W.

description:
Nope!

Nope, nope, nope. We were told that the lunch was delicious by some lady giving out coupons to the place. So we go in, are seated, and are given water. Yeah, my water had a bug part in it. When I asked for another water, I got an eye-roll. Then it came time to order. Money was tight, so my friend and I decided to order two plates of dim sum and share. The lady looked at us like we were insane and refused to do it. Apparently they had a $10 per person minimum and we weren't allowed to share.

We left.
author: Aisha K.

description: Looks like I should have read these reviews before coming here, but the truth is, it was my first time in China Town and I was so hungry, I didn't have a chance to yelp nor did I know my way around the city, I was too busy looking for parking. I parked my car down a block inside a garage and after taking my walk around in search of a good little restaurant, I was approached by a few kind Chinese women on a corner from different restaurants, all selling me their menus and all trying to get me come to their spots. Well, I was overwhelmed with the choices but then some one from China Town restaurant said "you come eat here" and I took a look up and seen the balcony seating and thought to myself "oh my goodness, I want to eat here" done deal. As we stepped inside I thought it was rather different that you take the stairs up leading you into the dining room, cool and it was nice a bit fancy but I seen Asians not tourist so I thought nothing of it, then the server took me to the balcony and I absolutely loved it, across me I could see the shops another restaurant with hanging chickens and on the side of me the alley where Chinese kids were playing. I tell you the experience was epic. But, when I looked at the menu, I noticed they were not too many choices and nothing was really different or new to me. Oh well, I was in a good mood, we made our decision as is and I still ordered meals, now I'm not going to come here and tell you that the food was terrible because it wasn't. It had nice presentation, colorful and flavorful, but it took them a while to bring my order, it wasn't all at the same time which I hate and seems like as soon as they brought me the food they had forgotten all about me and never once came to offer a refill on my drink or check on things. They forgot my kids apple juice, no condiments and when the check came they did add a gratuity on-top of it being super expensive for typical Chinese food I could of had elsewhere, don't let the looks of this place fool you into thinking your in Shanghai lol we definitely could have something with more heart at a mamas and papas place with much much better service.
author: Hector R.

description:
Stay away of this place. Food is very poor, service is even worse and a very generous tip is automatically added to the bill. If you don't notice that, you're likely to give them double tip. The only thing that they are good at is... marketing. My apetizer came with the main dish.
You'll never see any Chinese face in this restaurant. No Chinese would eat there.
author: Mariusz M.

description:
Wish I would have read the reviews before we ate there.  The service was awkward.  Strangely they do not believe that the soup should come before the meal.  We got an entrée before the soup.  The soup became cold and had no flavor.  The lemon chicken was fried and usually it is braised.  The pork ribs were 5 lackluster non meaty ribs for $15.  The desert was thrown on the table before any of our food was done.  My daughter had to stand on her chair to get a can of 7up 30 minutes after we ordered it.  Best part was they charged $5 for rice.  IT IS NOT INCLUDED.  

Apparently there is no manager either.  We waited 15 minutes for one to come over and multiple people tried to pry the payment out of hand.  They settled for $40, freaking joke.  

Don't eat here!
author: Keith E.

description:
SCAM. THIS PLACE IS A STRAIGHT UP SCAM PEOPLE, DON'T DO IT.

4 of us ordered drinks, 3 glasses of Dole with ice (labelled as "fruit punch" and a can of coke. those 4 drinks alone were 20 bucks. 

FORTUNATELY we were able to just pay for the drinks. After 5 minutes after ordering, we realized we wouldn't be able to all eat our moneys worth, we told them to cancel our order.

(while ordering btw the person taking our order [the manager] was ridiculously rude, and constantly scoffed at us)

the manager threw a FIT. she came out of the kitchen and started screaming at us, saying that the food is ready, the food has been cooked, that we had to pay or she'd call the police. (but when we told her then to bring the food out she said it needed time)

Thankfully, we stood our ground (sadly i feel like weary tourists may have a harder time though) and just paid for our drinks and left. 

seriously though, never EVER come here. It truly is a scam.
 
(and 3 BBQ pork buns should NEVER be 5 dollars. unless ur highrollin')
author: Jessica S.

description:
The thing is this place is really just a three star, maybe a two...but I love this place.

Their prices are decent, the food is okay, not terrible but not overly spectacular.  The ambiance is outstanding and thank god because the service is non-existent.

Their pork buns and pork ribs are exactly what they should be but their chicken feet are so nasty (even for chicken feet).

The ice cream at the end is a nice treat too.  Again there are tons of things about this place (service especially) that make this place terrible but for me there are enough redeeming qualities that i keep coming back.
author: Alvin B.

description:
Reading other yelp reviews, it appears this place is pretty hit or miss.

I've been here 3 times in total, twice last summer, and once last weekend. And thought I'd finally write up a review.

I always get one of the coupons from the girls on the corner for pot stickers + green tea ice cream for me (a big yummy plus in my book)!

2 out of 3 times I was really impressed by the food. I am a huge lemon chicken fan and this was by far the best I had tried. The third (and most recent time) everything was good... but not quite the same level of deliciousness. 

Service is sometimes a little slow, but I also tend to go during peak hours and they are waiting on a lot of tables then.

Each time I've gotten two entrees for 2, and have been pleased with the price and quantity of food. (Took some in a to-go box the most recent time even).

Also, in full disclosure, I am as white as they get. So if you are looking for a judgement on the authenticity of the food, I have no clue. But found it all very tasty to me!
author: Dylan P.

description:
Horrible food and too pricey. Everything seem to have been heated leftovers. Yuk!!
Stay away!
author: Nelson B.

description: I was not impressed. The food was awful.  We decided to give it shot. All 3 of us were disappointed. We will never eat there again.
author: Bruce S.

description:
Rip off
17$ for the smallest piece of bass I have ever seen.  Most Chinatown restaurants give you a whole fish for that price.
The fish and eggplant and shrimp were only ok quality (considering the locale), but it was very oily, and the service was horrible. 
We could have gotten steak for the $60, but I was with OOT so did not want to make a scene.
The barker at the corner gave a 20% coupon, but of course it did not apply to our food.  The outside was nice, but inside was a dump, and the bathroom scared me.
They gave us free green tea iced cream, but it was so artificial tasting, that we could not eat it. 
They even charged me for bad tea.and they added tip to the bill!!!!!
Their staff was not helpful; did not answer my questions.
The place was cheap and it was a huge rip off! do not go there!!!
author: P S.

description: Don't come in here. Run!!! Food is nasty and grease. Service is horrible I came in with just my boyfriend 2 people total and they added tip to our bill of 10$ wtf usually tip is only included when u have a party of 5 and more.
author: Alex G.

description:
Ew.

That's the best word I could think of to describe this place!  I would give it 0 stars if I could.  I regret wasting my money here for lunch.

It has really gone down since the last time I ate here, years and years ago.  It is a lot more expensive now and you don't even get quality for the price. 

They don't offer you water.  They told me that if I wanted water, I had to order it in a bottle.  Wtf?  Who does that???  I was eating there, the least you could do is offer tea or water for free.  My bill came up to nearly $20 for a small plate of chow mein and a water..  Ridiculous!  The service took forever and the place was so dirty.  Oh and the food...  I ordered a combination chow mein that was supposed to have a mixture of meats and veggies.  I got 1-2 slivers of each meat and two spears of broccoli on a tiny bed of noodles.  The meat was rancid.  Even my dog wouldn't eat it.  I mention it to the waitress and she just told me to pay inside.  Ugh, I should have just left without paying because I went inside and had to wait 15 minutes for someone to come ring me up.

Be warned, DO NOT GO HERE!
author: Jackie C.

description: very bad experience, waited our food for almost 50 mins, bad food quality and small portion, never  gonna go again :(
author: Rachel L.

description: I was in San Francisco's Chinatown, taking pictures until I got hungry, instinctively I start looking for places to eat. I didn't do much work actually because at one of the corners of an intersection, a Chinese lady grabbed my arm and gave me a handout that said "free pot sticker and ice cream." She also said it was the best restaurant in Chinatown. It was called Chinatown Restaurant afterall. So we went inside and there was quite a few people. We took a seat - my party of 3 including me- and took a look at the menu. The waitress comes and asks us if we'd like something to drink, so we say water and notice small tea cups on our table so we ask fot some tea also. This is where it got annoying... The waitress aggressively started asking if we'd like anything else to drink, like sparkling water, bottle of wine? Beer?! She does the same thing for the food. We got fried rice, orange chicken, and black pepper beef. She keeps asking us if we want more! As if what we ordered wasn't enough! Then the free pot stickers came and oh my Lord. It was the worst tasting dumplings. It had the texture of a smore with  gross inside, horrible! We then realized why there were so many people inside, all of them were walking in with the little free flyers! I wanted to tell them to turn back but our food came and we tried it. It was TOO DAMN SALTY! Honestly, Panda Express is better. So I just asked for the check, multiple times... We ordered 3 plates and our bill came out to $62.45!!! I asked them what happened so they said they included the pot sticker since it was after their promotional hours?! They charged $3 for the tea! And so I asked them what that little $8.10 subliminally written on the bottom was, and she said tip. No way mother father! We have a party of 3! Tip shouldn't be included, so I complained and asked the tip to be removed. They did and when they brought. Back my change, it was all in pennies. This topped the cake. So I handed them the pennies and said "here's your tip." We walked out and the laty came after us with the pennies and grabbed my hand and placed it in my hands. So I threw it on the ground of the front door. Walked out. And saw a couple getting dragged in and I quickly told them to turn back, and they did. Worst dining experience of my life!
author: Phillip K.

description: Meh. Got the chow fun and the fried chicken wings just ok. Nothing outstanding. Like others have stated the food is quite bland. Not coming back here again.
author: Janet D.

description:
I read all of the terrible reviews after we had already sat down and had I done this before I wouldn't have gone. But I'm decently happy with our visit. It was no means anywhere near a five star experience but it wasn't anywhere near being a one star experience. . 

Besides the all out blood feud that took place out side the restaurant with employees of the other restaurants tryin to get us to go to their places, it was pretty drama free. 

We had a bunch of dim sum which was good. It was flavorful but it could be better. 


The three stars comes from a place of hope instead of tearing the place down on these reviews. I feel like this place needs to care more about yelp and guest appreciation because these are your two biggest shots for redemption.
author: Matt N.

description: Rating for food 4 Stars. For the look of the place 1 Star. But how many hidden gems can be overlooked by the cosmetics? DimSum at 9pm and fresh, score. Tasty food, Friendly staff double score. Rice noodles are my favorite.
author: Norma S.

description: I laugh my ass off every time I walk by this place and see the dumb arse tourists sitting on the balcony eating this crap because some illegal handed them a coupon for 4 free dumplings.  Go ahead, try this place.  I dare you!!
author: Kyle K.

description: Horrible experience overall. Terrible service. Overcharged us. Added a hefty tip to our bill without informing us. Shady business.
author: Jeremiah M.

description: This is a perfectly good family style Chinese restaurant. The they serve dim sum, westernized and authentic style Chinese food. The service is good and I've never been disappointed with the food. Very reasonable prices and an easy choice to make if you're in Chinatown with your family. Would come here again.
author: Peter L.

description:
I decided to go to Chinatown restaurant after being lured in by a coupon for free pot stickers and green tea ice cream. I had checked out a few places and this one seemed to be nice and the staff handing out fliers outside seemed to be nice a well--that was just a tease to lure you inside. After being seated I opened my menu to discover that their food was way overpriced and steamed white rice is an extra $1.50 per entrée. I wanted to leave after seeing this and after waiting for 15 minutes to finally have someone, other than my original waitress, take my order. There seemed to be a lot of people working inside the restaurant, but I was snubbed and ignored by all of them. Finally my order was taken and my pot stickers and meal came out. The chicken and vegetables that I ordered turned out to be greasy fried chicken and the vegetables were something that looked like greasy and overcooked onions, peppers, and celery--nothing like I was expecting. I ate a few bites quickly and boxed up the rest as because I had waited for my food for so long I had to leave so I could be on time for my plane to go home. The check finally came along with my melting green tea ice cream and fortune cookie. The check included the tip of $2 of which I left only $1 for their very poor service--I should have left nothing. 

If you are looking for good service and food look elsewhere--do not be fooled by the coupon for free food, there is a reason they are offering it. Chinatown Restaurant does not show the hospitality or have the same food quality that I am sure many of the restaurants throughout Chinatown do. The next time I am in San Francisco I will keep walking past this restaurant!
author: Chandra J.

description:
Searching for a typical Chinese restaurant in Chinatown, we were lured in by an employee telling us the lunch special was lots of food for $11.95.  The menu had usual Americanized Chinese food items and figured it would be okay. 
I was somewhat worried when I saw mostly tourists inside and no Chinatown residents but we decided to try it.
Appetizers of satay chicken on a stick were just okay and not very flavorful and the crispy egg rolls tasted bland.  The rice was good!
Beef with broccoli was horrible.  The beef was drenched in grease and the broccoli was not cooked enough and was in huge pieces.  I told the woman about the beef and she said it was oyster sauce but it sure didn't taste like it.  We left the entire platter on the table.
The best part of the meal was the green tea ice cream which came with the meal.
author: M'Liss H.

description:
I wasn't really impressed with this Chinese restaurant. It was really overpriced, and I wasn't really happy with the quality of the food. McDonalds would of probably been better. The portions are really small, and not worth eating. 

The tables are so small, I felt like i was stuck in a plane lavatory. Even if there were larger tables next to us, we were not allowed to change.
author: Erik M.

description:
We read all the brutal reviews but were in such a rush and fell so in love with the balcony seating that we went for it. 

We got the BBQ pork buns, sweet sesame balls, chicken pot stickers, and Hong Kong style crispy noodles. 

Honestly, it was a super adequate experience and the food was def no worse than any other average Chinese place. The balcony, again, was so charming, that I'm fine rating this place generously. 

Be careful, though, they may sneak a tip charge onto your bill.
author: C A.
