for your sake i hope you're a lot smarter than i am and you check yelp before eating here instead of after you take a bite of this awful food. i found this food to be so offensive, you would think it was talking crap about my my mother. my friend and i had the fried rice, curry chicken dim sum and shrimp roll dim sum.

the fried rice was the blandest rice i've ever had. i've had steamed white rice with more flavor. the chicken curry was ok at best and the shrimp was ok until you put their death sauce on it.

the place is definitely a tourist trap due to the fact that it looks like an awesome place to eat with it's balcony outside seating overlooking chinatown and because locals would know better than to eat here. also it was really gross watching pigeons pick at the dirty plates lets on tables waiting to be bussed and not seeing the tables being wiped down with any kind of sanitary towel.  

lastly this place was way too expensive. when i think about the food and how it's priced i kind wanna laugh but i then remember how poor i am and realize how not funny it is.
author: Michael G.

description: As a costumer, I felt that they were cheating their costumers, and the price of the food was over priced compared to the quality of the food and the amount of the food. Also, their waiters were dishonest. Most, if not all Chinese restaurants provide free tea. However not only did the tea cost money, but they asked if we wanted tea which sounded as if it was free like water. Instead when the bill came, the tea costed $3. Also it was not even tea, it was not fresh, had no flavor, it smelt like there was mold, it was unsanitary, and I could easily have explained it as "yellow water." Also when the bill came the tip was already charged in the bill. They hadn't even stated the percent of tip. When we calculated the tip on our own, it was close to 20%. And the service was bad, they did not speak nicely, or take away any finished dishes. Overall, the food was not met to the price we payed, and the service was horrible yet we were forced to pay 20% tip. I do not recommend this place, please save yourself from spending your money and time on overpriced food and horrible service.
author: Lorraine C.

description:
We came here because my friend from louisiana had never been to chinatown and the lady happened to hand us a flyer as we were hungry and he took it as a sign. 

I didn't think the food was horrible at all, I would give this 4 stars for the food actually, but I deduct one for the price.  We had dim only sum, and I thought it was actually pretty good, so I am surprised by all the negative reviews.  But I am wondering if people are just swayed by the other reviews.

I would come back if the food was cheaper. End of story.
author: Carrie G.

description: This restaurant has good flavor however it has a large flaw. This restaurant is extremely greasy. Everything, from the curry chicken skewers to the sweet potato cakes, were covered in grease. We had to dry off all the food with napkins to get some of the yellow fluids off. Another con is that the pork dumplings were really not special. They tasted just like any other dumpling and were too greasy as well. They fall apart easily and the filling was not very tasty. My third con is that my father ordered a cup of soup and they brought this giant bowl for the whole table. My father told them he only wanted a cup for him only but they said oh well I thought it was for everyone since you came with two more people. They wouldn't take it back and we payed for a big bowl. Service was a 4/5.
author: Danny A.

description: Food is okay! But way too pricy! Itz a restaurant targeting and ripping off tourists, period!
author: Larry W.

description:
Sucks.
-Bad, oily food
-Tourist trap
-Add their own tip, WTF!@#!@#!@#
-Poor service
-Gave my order to someone else, and did not even care :x
-All the -ge reviews are true. do NOT go here
-Overly expensive for the quality of food, service and ambiance 

+Green tea ice-cream was nice I guess. 

Would NEVER under any circumstances go here again.
author: Parag K.

description: the food was like.. ok. it was decent I guess b minus at best. they took forever to make chow mein which is silly and when my friend changed his mind about his order the waitress asked "why" which was pretty rude and weird and he didn't really want tea is all. also they automatically added an 18% gratuity for a party of 3 people which I'm pretty sure is against some sort of restaurant protocol and maybe illegal
author: Dana H.

description: I don't know why this place has bad reviews, this food is just like the food in China. We had chow fun, taro puffs, and the shrimp rice noodle roll. All really good. I highly recommend the taro puff
author: Tanuki T.

description: The food is ok, but they price it high.  Mongolian beef without rice is around $15.  You need to order rice seperately if you need rice.  They have added tip to my bill without my knowledge and have room on the credit card receipt for tip.  I haven't seen any restaurant  they add tip for two persons.
author: E D.

description:
Husband and I walked thru Chinatown and got the recommendation to stop by here by our concierge at our hotel. we read the reviews on yelp and were apprehensive, but went in with little expectations.  We are from Hawaii so we have really good Chinese food back home, and my husband's part Chinese so it's always interesting to see how tastes vary. We got the $19.99 special that has a mix of different menu items in smaller portions. We thought it was all pretty good. 

Pros 
-service was respectable and timely
-owners daughter was a very hard worker, quickly running out food, bussing tables, taking orders, and helping out her dad run the show (mom was off tonight). 

Cons
-don't use the bathrooms there. Definitely dangerously dirty
-you will wait a little while for your food, so don't expect your food for at least 7-10 minutes
-tea is not free here...$3
author: Alice And Steve S.

description: We only got Dim Sum. It's not terrible, it's just not good either.
author: Brian G.

description: The food was barely good, it took over an hour for it to arrive and then we were served wrong. They threw straws at us,the customers, no offers for refills, and the green tea was served cold.
author: Samsher R.

description:
Quite possibly the worst Chinese restaurant I've ever been to. I was HIGHLY disappointed with the Chinatown restaurant, and not only was it a waste of money but a HUGE waste of time.. 

On vacation to San Francisco we spent 1 day venturing through chinatown.. We picked the Chinatown restaurant because we were starving, there seemed to be quite a few people inside and someone handed us a flier earlier that day that looked somewhat appealing. When we went to place our order the waiter was so incredibly rude that we did not order entrees she snatched up our coupon and yelled we could not use this, then said it wasn't enough food for 2 people. We ordered 3 different types of Dim Sum.. The sweet potato one was edible but very bland and tasted somewhat undercooked. The shrimp Dim Sum was downright disgusting and had a cigarette taste. The pork Dim Sum was slightly better then the shrimp but still very bland. I would NEVER go back to this restaurant again, even if everything was free. 

Later on we asked a local about her favorite restaurants and she informed us everyone that lives there goes to the small restaurants on Jackson street. Next time we will head there for food!
author: Sarah S.

description: We were on our pacific coast road trip, arrived at San Francisco passed 9:30, decided to dine at Chinatown. Most of the restaurants were closed, so end up eating here - staff were disorganized, the food was horrible, the menu said grill but in fact was fried, running of rice... Totally horrible experience. Don't go there, Eat somewhere else!
author: Ying C.

description:
Apparently the staff at this place varies from day to day, because a lot of people who have written reviews here say that the food was either bland or way too salty. I found the food to be really delicious. And I'm familiar enough with Chinese food to say with a certain level of confidence that I noticed no MSG.

On the day that my girlfriend and I ate here, the service was polite and attentive, not overbearing at all. Perhaps they could have been just a touch more attentive, but they were pretty busy. The politeness of the entire staff more than made up for it.

We decided to share the dim sum special, and it was delicious. It certainly wasn't microwaved and it definitely didn't come from Costco. Some people have a tendency to exaggerate their disappointment. The buns were warm, savory and delicious, the fried portions were crispy and light, and everything stayed warm throughout the duration of our meal. Plain and simple, it was delicious. Period. I'm sorry that others were expecting more, or possibly were there on a bad day, but my one experience with this place was extremely satisfying.

Sure the price was a little steep, but come on, you're in Chinatown, the biggest tourist trap in the Bay Area. You're going to pay more, period. If you want value for your money, go to any number of buffet places in the East Bay. Duh.

I would recommend this place, and have.
author: Guano P.

description: I think the 1.5 star rating is unwarranted. I've been here twice and both times the food was great. It wasn't the best but definitely fulfilled my craving for good Chinese food. It seems most people just take issue with the automatic tip they add but its really simple to ask what the additional charge is. I will admit that the service is a little slow though. I would come back.
author: Robert R.

description:
Oddly, my visiting mother and I were not enticed by the coupons being handed out on the street, we just picked a restaurant and went in. 

To be fair, the food was not that bad. Pricey, yes, but this is San Francisco. The service was lukewarm but they did offer us more raspberry iced tea. It was super-sweet, tasting like Kool-Aid. 

Then the bill came. There was an $11.00 charge for beverages. I asked a bus boy what it was. He took the check, asked someone, came back and said the teas were $2.75 each and we had had four of them. "That's not right," I told him, "I'm not paying eleven dollars for tea." He just walked away. 

I left cash for the food and a few dollars for tax and drinks and we left. I know that's passive-aggressive but oh well.

As we waited to cross the street a block away, out waitress appeared holding the check! "How much did you leave?" she asked. I told her. She said the bill was more, I explained I wasn't paying three dollars for sugar water and without free refills. She of course demanded I pay. "You're the only ones who don't give free refills," I told her. She suggested I go around to the other restaurants and see for myself. "This is Chinatown...." Ugh!

"What am I supposed to tell my manager?" she asked. "Tell him he's charging unfair prices for drinks." She was shouting and I told her the conversation was over. She grabbed my coat sleeve and threatened to call the police. 

Really? Are we really having this conversation...here...over ten bucks? Yes, yes we were.

Then the (woman) manager showed up on the street corner. (Uhm...who's watching the store?) Her voice was loud and shrill with a strong Chinese accent. "You have to pay!" she shrieked. I explained my position again. "You got free potstickers and free ice cream, but you don't pay?!" "We didn't get free anything," I said, "I paid for the food." "You look like nice people, nice clothes, why you do this?" The crowds of pedestrians were staring as they passed us. 

She pointed out I had not left enough for the food and even two teas. My mother calmly asked how much that would be. The two women chattered in Chinese and came up with a figure only five dollars more than I had left. I gave them five bucks and they returned to the restaurant. The manager gave her face a flick of her finger, staring right at me saying, "Shame, shame!"

Of course I would have avoided all this had I read yelp reviews first, but out and about, who stops and researches a little Chinese joint for lunch? 

Thankfully Mom was more amused than embarrassed and we've chalked it all up to the adventures of travel.
author: Scott S.

description: We walked into this place. We sat down and as we were reading the menu and looking at dishes being served we decided to walk out.  Not a very good place.  I am glad we walked out. After reading all the other bad reviews maybe it was for the best.
author: Ali F.

description: I wish I'd read the reviews prior to coming here. Horrible food at very high prices. And the server had the audacity to write in her own tip.
author: Alex B.

description: Do not go here!!! The waitress showed us a small menu card indicating several dishes included for $9.95 per person. The dishes were poorly prepared and the beef was very stringy. Then the bill came with charges of $19.95 each, plus $6 for tea. The waitress avoided me when I protested to the waiter. Of course, he brought out a menu card that said $19.95 per person. Scammers knowing tourists will never return. We are locals and will spread the news of these crooks and bad chefs. Would give negative star rating if able.
author: M M.

description:
There are women out on the street that hand out coupons for this place and that is what gets this place business.

I have gone to this place twice and will not be going back.  OK, first of all you have to go up a huge flight of stairs to make it into the restaurant and when you catch your breath you make your way to your seat.  Each time I have gone I have gotten the same waitress and she is absolutely RUDE. 

We told her we wanted the an entree which the coupon said you get potstickers and ice cream included and that we were not very hungry so we would be sharing the dishes between the two of us.  The coupon said you get free pot stickers and free ice cream with the purchase of a entree, but when we told her we were going to split, she said with a HUGE attitude, "ok fine you will only get one pot sticker and no ice cream."  LOL.

If you are looking for the traditional dim sum experience then this is not the place for you, they will not be wheeling the carts around from you to choose from, you choose your dim sum from their menu and they bring them all out at once to your table.  The food is ok, I mean it is ok nothing to really brag about.

I went there twice because it is right there at the opening of Chinatown and it was just there so I went, but I'm not going back and it is not because of the food it it completely because the waitress it an absolute jerk.  I ALWAYS leave a tip and a nice tip at that, but after the attitude this lady gave we left nothing and I felt no guilt about doing so.

And where is my dam fortune cookie ????   

DON'T RECOMMEND.
author: Lee C.

description:
Siu mai - no shrimp. Tatses like ground pork
Hargow - Small. They put green beans inside..why? Thick skin.
Shrimp rolls - average
Corn soup - $10 for a regular size (feeds about two), Overpriced IMO
Eggplant dim sum - oily but not bad
xiao long bao (spelling?) - not soupy at all. Bland. Seemed cold when we got it. Had to ask for vinegar on the side because they didn't bring us any.

All this after tax and tip came out to $50! Disappointing meal for a disappointing price. 

I think people only come here because it doesn't look dirty like other places in Chinatown. I think this place is for those who haven't experienced dim sum very often and don't know what to compare it to. I guess being located in Chinatown doesn't necessarily mean it's authentic.

The free green tea ice cream they serve at the end of the meal isn't enough to make me come here. I'd rather go to Yank Sing outside of Chinatown if I want good dim sum in a clean environment.
author: Angelica P.

description: 0 stars would be better. Run, far, far away. Don't get suckered in like my parents did. Absolutely disgusting food.
author: Lulu B.

description:
The bill came with tip already included...  that says a lot about the business.  Service wasn't rude or anything, but... hey, a tip needs to be earned!!!

The food was very mediocre.  I've had better Chinese food in a random town in Canada.... and the place wasn't even run by Chinese.  

Disappointed by this random encounter.  Lured by coupon but never again.
author: T J.

description:
Terrible service!

Don't get fooled into going here! there are a buch of old chinese ladies passing out fliers to go to this spot, you get attracted to the free pot stickers with the flyer, but trust me, it's not even worth it! the food is not even good, panda express is a million times better! and it's pricy! to top it all, the servers are extremely rude, and take forever to serve...
author: Patricio O.

description: Never go here, Total rip off. Takes advantage of tourist. Crap food. Coupon is bullshit, they wouldn't honor it once we got inside the restaurant.
author: Chrystal Anne M.

description:
Yelp needs to start handing out warning stickers for restaurants that score poorly and this is absolutely one of them. I don't need to walk in the restaurant to tell you this place is a mistake. Just stand outside the restaurants ventilation system and you'd think they are making a mean brew of dead cats. Swing around the side of the building if you want to see underpaid ear picking cooks with the doors wide open to the alley so the rats can come in and have some of that dead cat stew.

Try Golden Star restaurant or even the places directly across the street. Shameful that they use a landmark to pedal off their poison.
author: Wil M.

description: DON'T go there avoid this place its a mistake . Not very clean . Should have looked at reviews before should have been more careful at were we picked  Lastly  and something came walking across table from under my bowl ice cream when server put on our table.
author: Ray K.

description:
This place is a disgrace. Worst Chinese food ever, let alone in Chinatown! Saying the food is unauthentic is the best compliment one can give. The service is mediocre. It charges for both tea and white rice which come complimentary in most other places. The tea is very bland, and it charges $3 for it. What a rip-off! To top it off, it is so unscrupulous that that it includes %18 service charge surreptitiously. What outrage!

AVOID AT ALL COST!
author: eric y.

description: Ok food.  THEY ADD tip automatically on bill but write it in Chinese.   be very careful.   I asked them and they answered in very broken English that it was the tip added to the bill.  Then when the credit card bill comes it still has the line for tip (even though the tip was included)
author: J A.

description: The food was good but service left something to be desired.  Yes, we were a large group (10) but my dad had to keep getting up to find someone to bring us more water and more hot tea.  Additionally, they said we were short $10 but we counted it twice and when I asked the waitress to bring me the cash back so I could count it again in front her she told me she couldn't because they already put it in the register. Our bill was $160.60 (which they added gratuity to the bill), we gave them cash in the amount of $161.  Our entire family has worked in a restaurant at some point and you never put the cash away in the register until the bill is settled.  They were refusing to let us leave.  We ended up just paying it because it was 10pm and just wanted to be done with it.
author: Cristen K.

description:
Shame on ME for not knowing better!!

 I was lured in by a lady on the corner passing coupons out. I took one look at the balcony seating and thought that it would give us a great perspective on the festivities below for New Year's.. I know the good spots to eat in Chinatown but this was only one of two that I knew of with balcony seating.

It was ridiculously busy that day and I'd say 90% of the customers were tourists. When we got to the hostess she gave us two menus and instructed us to go outside to the balcony and seat ourselves. No biggie...it's busy and I have no problem doing that. 

When we ordered it was pretty much you don't qualify for any specials because you need to have 4 or more people (We had 2). The coupon we received on the street? Total bait and switch. We settled on the $19.95 per person meal which looked like an incredible amount of food on paper. We also asked for one coke and a beer.

It took FOREVER to get our first dish...a plate of tiny little potstickers that look like the frozen ones I get from Costco :( Whatever..hoping the next plate will be better. About 15 minutes later a small plate of mongolian beef and two tiny bowls of white rice. Another 10 minutes later we get a plate of veggies and chicken (I think) and a small plate of plain...really plain noodles. Finally we get 2 eggrolls and 2 fried shrimp. That was pretty much it. Every plate was the size of my hand...it should have been about 3-4 times that amount by Chinese food standards. Nothing tasted good and all was lukewarm. Anyone who knows Chinese food...at least authentic food...knows if it doesn't have "wok hay" that it sucks. Wok Hay is kinda like that extra TLC when you cook, the fire that roars under the wok to such a high temp that flavors come out perfectly and always...ALWAYS! Piping HOT! It's an art form that foodies, especially Chinese foodies appreciate and understand and recognize when it is done right. Just because something is palatable doesn't mean it's good. Chef Boyardee makes raviolis but nothing compares to a handmade Italian ravioli in home made red sauce.

They finished it off with 2 small scoops of ice cream and a fortune cookie. When the bill came, it was $57.00!!! Oh yeah they added their own tip. I couldn't help but feel cheated, so I asked for the menu to check what was missed. Sure enough they shorted us on 1 dish. It was only after complaints to two people that they refunded us $5. 

The view was nice up there but it was cold and not pleasant at all after 4pm. In terms of Chinese food they really should be ashamed of themselves for ripping tourists off..No wonder why there were no locals there. I've eaten Chinese food my entire life all over the country and even in China. This place is THE WORST in terms of quality, value, and service. They are lucky to have customers that can't tell the difference otherwise they'd be out of business. Food is soooooo representative of culture and it sucks that a place like this exists in Chinatown where people come to experience the best!
author: Carol A.

description: Food was just  ok but way over priced for chinese food and service.  Worst service ever.. you would think they will  a good service when they charge automatic tip, wrong!  It took 3 requests before we finally got more water and guess what, the server just fill the cup not nearly half fill and my daughter's cup she hardly put any and I said really and she made a stupid comment that water in SF is very expensive!! Never again!! People stay away from this place!!
author: Lyn S.

description: Horrible place. They drag tourists in off the streets, give them horrible food, then overcharge them. More bizarrely, the restaurant is apparently aligned with a local political boss in the city named Rose Pak, and the women who operate the street dragnet for tourists are also known to beat up on the local anti-Communist Party activists... oh yes, it's complicated, and ridiculous: beware.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Careful with the killer pigeons!!!

Not a joke. We were passing by when a beer bottle fell from this restaurant's second floor onto the sidewalk. They apologized and said it was a pigeon (*.*)

I agree with all other comments here, there are many other options in Chinatown to just fall for this tourist trap. 

It may lure you with its more westernized (readable) menu, but you are better off with many other traditional Chinese spots close by.

If you want an easy to read menu paired with excellent food, walk another block to R and G Lounge in Kearny.
author: Leopoldo P.

description:
I'm in agreement with the majority of reviews here.  I'm new to town and am testing out places in my neighborhood and will certainly not return here.  

I'm not a snob by any means, but this place was mediocre at best.  The service was bland and perfunctory.  I realize it's in tourist-central, but c'mon...they were in such a rush to get people in and out!

And the food was just dull, flavorless, and greasy.  I had some chicken, and a couple orders of dim sum.  If I have a craving for Chinese food, I'll just go to Panda Express.
author: Robert M.

description: Food was decent. Service was ATROCIOUS! Couldn't wait to get out of there. Also, not ADA friendly, we were forced to climb stairs in order to eat there even after asking for an elevator. Had we not already had a gift certificate we'd have gone somewhere else for dinner based on the greeting and stair climb.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Warning! Warning! Warning!

Coming here was a MISTAKE.

We came here today because, like Steve S., we were attacked with coupons by this woman on Stockton Street, lured in by 20% off entrees and free pot stickers.  

A gimmick, I tell you!

If you think this place is a good deal, don't be fooled.  I mean, look at the facts:
+ It's called Chinatown Restaurant.  Think about that.
+ The number of tourists and non-Chinese folks outnumber the locals in here.
+ They need to hand out coupons to lure you in. 

It's a trick, and it ain't worth it!  

And here's more reasons, in detail:
- Food = HELLA EXPENSIVE.  Entrees were priced into the teens, absurdly high prices for the kind of food you're getting!  That 20% off makes no difference when you're paying like $20 for a dish that should be $7.95.  The dim sum here was about $5 a steamer, omgwut?!
- Food = NOT GOOD.  We ordered fried rice, seafood tofu soup, pan-fried green onion pancake, tofu and black mushrooms with bok choy, and got the free pot stickers.  Fried rice portion was small, and it tasted dried and mediocre.  Although the taste of the seafood tofu soup was passable and comparable to other versions I've tried, it was way watered down.  Pancake had no taste. Tofu was decent, mushrooms were super salty.  Pot stickers were probably the best thing about the meal, and that was because they tasted like the frozen heat 'n serve kind that I like (I bet they probably were!). 
- Our main waitress was rushing us.  To be fair, our other waitress was really nice. 

For the five of us, after tax and a 15% gratuity that was added into the bill, it was $60.  

Oh my god.  Although $60 is certainly cheap for five people anywhere else, for this kind of Chinese food, $60 is ridiculously high, do not be fooled by any non-Chinese standards!  

You should not be paying this much for not-tasty Chinese food, in one of these kitschy Chinatown restaurants that pander to tourists more than anything else.

And the final way you can tell it ain't authentic or tasty: you don't lose your hearing in here because it's not packed full of Cantonese grandmamas and grandpapas yelling at each other, with tables packed way too tightly for comfortable maneuvering.
author: Vivian C.

description: Horrible, rude and abusive service. Plus, they tried to include a 20% tip on the bill and we were only a party of three and they charged us for items we did not order.  This is definitely a tourist trap.  Hope you  all don't make the mistake we made and check Yelp first.
author: Cheryl B.

description: zero stars. This place was horrible. We fell for the trap too. My wife and mother were not to happy with their meals. My meal tasted rancid. A couple hours after leaving all our stomachs were turning. I also noticed just before leaving that they offer shark fin soup. Do not support them. I feel guilty for even walking in this place. I'd rather go to any panda express and eat leftovers off the floor.
author: Brian S.

description: where do I begin .... This place is straight up BULLSHIT! I wish i could give them 0 stars. The best thing I ate was my free ice cream with a stale fortune cookie. I barely started eating my food before I pushed it aside, didn't even take it to go. I wouldn't have offered it to a bum on the street for fear of them throwing it at me in disgust. The food is terrible. One of our orders was LATE and COLD. I doubt they have any repeat business. The service .... Smh. They bother until you order and then leave you alone with disgusting food. I should have known when they gave me yellow-grey lemons to add to my water. $35 wasted. Put your money in your gas tank and drive somewhere else. PLEASE. At the end of my meal I politely screamed "I hate this place!" they were rude enough to circle a tip on your tab that they didn't even deserve .... TERRIBLE. Worst part of my trip to San Francisco......
author: Ashley S.

description:
Probably the worst restaurant I've ever been to.

I took my girlfriend there after a long day of walking around SF, we were tired and hungry, and this place looked reasonable, especially because they gave us the coupon for free potstickers with the purchase of any entree.  Both me and my girlfriend speach Chinese, so I asked one of the waitresses if we could use the coupon with one of their Sichuan specials, and she said "Yeah, that's fine."  We asked the young girl there if she could take our order, and she said "Wait." and just started wandering around aimlessly.  Almost 10 minutes later the manager finally came to the table to take our order, she said she's the only one allowed to take orders, and we ordered the Sichuan boiled beef and the free potstickers.  She told us if we wanted the free potstickers we had to buy 2 entrees, because we were a party of 2, even though the coupon said free potstickers with ANY entree.

What the hell?  That was a $18 entree, big enough for the two of us, who the hell orders 2 overpriced entrees at a Chinese restaurant for 2 people?  We argued for 5 minutes, and called over the other waitress who told us we could use it, and she just shrugged and walked away.  They refused to honor the coupon, which was the only reason we went in there.  The food was mediocre at best, oily as hell, and $5 for a large bowl of rice?  Again, what the hell?

They refused to come to the table for the rest of the night, and I'm glad I paid with cash after reading the stories about the waitresses adding on their own tips.  We left 1 cent and the free potsticker coupon in the check holder.

There's your tip.

I doubt anyone comes to this place more than once, it's just AWFUL.
author: Jon S.

description:
HORRID!!!  This place is a SCAM!  They will automatically add 15% tip to the bill and present you with a receipt that shows no tip has been added.  If you are not sharp and don't see the second receipt, you will be fooled into thinking you should pay tip.          

TERRIBLE SERVICE and TERRIBLE FOOD!   
The food was most definitely not restaurant quality.  I can go to costco and purchase potstickers and fried rice that tasted way better than this.   

Service was horrible. They claim "free validation" for parking.  Please read the asterisk in small print *for orders $30 or more".  Guess what?  My bill came out to $29.80 and they still would not validate my parking.  Geez come on folks it's only 20 cents.  And the one of the waitresses lied and told me they only validate for orders over $40.        

Don't get scammed into thinking you are getting a good deal from the coupon. They require you purchase an expensive entree.     

Man I should have read the Yelp page before I came to this restaurant. Unfortunately my family and I were hungry and decided to go to this place.

Will never go back here again.
author: Alex H.

description:
Is this place some kind of a joke? They rope you in with a (seemingly) good coupon and it just goes downhill from there. Granted, it was busy because it was Chinese New Year, but the service was just ridiculous.

The two waitresses serving the downstairs dining area were doing an awful job to begin with. Then they suddenly got into a screaming match - yes, a screaming match - with each other! The younger waitress actually ran to the corner of the room, slumped onto the floor and cried. Really! Just like an effing reality show! 

Then another woman (Head waitress? Owner's wife?) came down from the second floor and the three of them had another screaming match. In the middle of the dining area. In full view of all the patrons. I am not making this up or exaggerating in any way. Service ground to a halt for a good 5 minutes. In retrospect, we should've just walked out on the bill. We sure as heck didn't leave a tip. Basically this place deserves to go out of business.

Oh, and the best thing I can say about the food is it didn't give us food poisoning.
author: Julia D.

description:
Friend and I were hungry after tea tasting. Got hustled on the street as we were walking.  4 Free potstickers and green tea ice cream when you order on entree'.

Great location to have lunch on a sunny day. We sat outside on the upper terrace. Pigeons. Dirty facility. Dirty windows. House mother was very pushy.

Overall food was Ok. Not great not good. got out the door for $30 with tip. No drinks. water and food only. Will never eat here again as there are so many way better restaurants in the area for the same money. 

Great view on a nice day. Thats it. Decent service. Friendly Waitress.
author: Dylan C.

description:
Well, I'm happy to see that my party of three is not alone in the miserable experience we had at this place.
The server was so rude that it was actually funny, only I was the only one who had a sense of humor about it.
One example was the priceless moment she asked if we were ready to order and when we said yes, she said "no you're not" and promptly turned to the next table.

By diet standards, I shouldn't even BE at a Chinese food place, but my out of town guests chose... with out checking Yelp (argh!!) 

We were having a hard time choosing our items, and she was anything BUT patient and helpful. 
Finally one of our party got fed up (but not in the food sense, lol...)

WE LEFT!!! She had the nerve to charge us 3 dollars for the crappy tea that should be free with any meal, even take out places give you tea....while you wait. 

We got out on the street where there are a million other places to choose from in China Town and I actually laughed my ass off.
author: Roanna Z.

description: Most terrible Chinese restaurant ever! Waitress lied about not serving water and charged $3 for tea. And they automatically add tips for even 2 people! Food was terrible and bad service. Don't ever go there
author: Kelly G.

description: Walking down the street we were caught in the middle between a war waged between two Chinese restaurants. A woman inviting us into her small shop on ground level, or the crazy lady waving a coupon in front of our faces basically grabbing  me by the hand and pulling me upstairs. We were seated on a cute balcony above the city streets and were served promptly. The food was decent, but the prices were a little high, especially considering the poor service we had.  Once we were corralled in the restaurant and the food was dropped off we were basically forgotten. No refills on drinks were offered, nor did they check to see  how the meal was. In fact I had to ask for a box and the check and the server seemed annoyed. I don't recommend spending your money at Chinatown Restaurant.
author: Zak P.

description: Good quality ingredients, but only average preparation.  Portion sizes were just ok.
author: Jj J.

description: Well... It's rating is accurate. Nuff said.
author: Danan C.

description: Well, you did it San Francisco. I have never in my life had food that I couldn't eat! After getting a free pot sticker coupon, my family and I went in. Boy, was I in for the worst meal ever. The broccoli wasn't cooked at all and the beef wasn't seasoned or marinated or tenderized. There is a reason they have a different room filled with Chinese people. All the white people were in the main room looking at each other like, "You have got to be kidding me?" This place looked like a dentist office or a animal slaughter house because everyone was so sad. I understand there are people rating this restaurant high, but they must belong to the VIP room.
author: Derek S.

description:
HORRIBLE ATTITUDE and OVERPRICED FOOD ($35 for 10 crabmeat dumplings?)!

Friends who know me, know that I am tolerant of the general chinatown rudeness - I find it funny and even charming.

BUT, the rudeness at Chinatown Restaurant from this rude waitress (or manager?) was just pure rudeness - I felt insulted!

3 of us walked in, lured by the cute looking balcony.
We were not hungry, and just wanted a few dimsum before heading elsewhere.

We waited for a long time for our water and to make order.
A grumpy looking waitress (who could be a manager) finally came to take our order, and this was the dialogue:

"What do you want to eat?"
"I'll have D4" I said, pointing to the menu for her.
"What is that?  I don't remember."
I repeated the whole dish name.
When each of us ordered one dimsum each, she looked at us in disbelieve.

"That's it?"  She said.
"Ya this is our second eatery, we just want to try you guys out."

"There is a $10 minimum each.  This is a restaurant."  she said coldly.

THIS IS A RESTAURANT?!

Wow...  we left.
author: Yee T.

description: i gave 3 since i didn't have a good experience here. I checked with the waitress for the spicy fish fillet( shui zhu yu) before Iordered , since they have pics on the menu. I asked her which one is that I will get since there is another type I really don't want. But after she confirmed to me the one I'm ordering will be the one I really want, the dish served was still the one i don't like. And even this one, it's the worst I've ever tried, it's sour taste and not yummy at all, the portion is small to for the price. I won't come again.
author: Ying X.

description: DO NOT COME HERE!!!! This place is not worth what they charge. The food sucks almost as bad as the service.
author: Jonathan H.

description: You'd think that in SF Chinatown even the bad places would be at least decent but this place is horrible.  It was probably the worst Chinese meal I've ever had.  You're better off buying Chinese takeout at a supermarket,  Bad service, bad quality ingredients  -- the meat was tough, the veggies were soggy, I couldn't even finish my dish.  I should have known better as soon as  I walked in when I saw that all the guests were non-Chinese tourists.
author: Ed G.

description: Yes, I was lured in by the ladies on the corner and the outdoor 2nd floor dining looked great. Then the sun went down and I was freezing. But it didn't matter. The food (Tsingtao beer, kung pao chicken & pork fried rice) was great, they gave me my free pot stickers AND ice cream & a fortune cookie at the end. I like this place. Hopefully, next time I go it will be warmer.
author: David D.

description:
THIS PLACE SHOULD BE CLOSED!!  
IT IS HORRIBLE!! 
WORST PLACE I HAVE EVEN BEEN!! 
WARNING, DO NO'T GO!!! 
TOURIST TRAP!! 
DISGUSTING ROTTEN TASTING FOOD AND RUDE SERVICE!!  POSSIBLE HEALTH HAZZARD!!!!!!!!!!  
WARNING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I should have known when they were handing out discount coupons.  I joined yelp to write a review on this place, yes, it was that horrible, I am not crazy, just pissed off by how horrible of an experience it was.   I am not surprised to see so many other people agree that this place is bad.  If only there were a way we could get this misserable excuse for a restaurant closed.  

So, my girlfirend and I were going to go to our usual chinese food place when we got the dumb idea to try someplace new becuase chinatown restaurant was handing out discount coupons w/ free potstickers.  I broke my personal philosphy not to go to a new restaurant unless it had been recommended to me.  

So what happened??  Well, we were seated promptly and it was obvious that is was a touristy place from the get go.  When they brought us the free potstickers they came with this nasty tasting, almost rancid flavored, vinegar sauce.  I am use to eating gyooza's as they are called in japan with soy sauce, so I sort of forvgave them, and handed them back the vinegar sauce plate that reaked so bad it was going to make me nautious.  

They handed out coupons for 20~25% off, though it seems like they had jacked the prices up before doing so - offsetting the coupon effect.  My girlfirend ordered beef and brokoli and I order genral tsao's chicken.  

Our food came prompty and my girlfriend liked her beef and brocoli but my chicken dinner tasted odd to me as though somthing was a bit off and it had a hidden foul taste to it.  Not extremely disgusting, but my body immdiatly said "wo!!, don't eat that, somthing is not right with it."  I thought that maybe it was just me. My gf tried it too and she immediatly had an unpleasant look on her face. "there is somthing deffinitly wrong with that".

Being a guy who usually avoids confrontations over minor things, I made the mistake of trying to explain to the waitress in a polite way that I felt there was somthing wrong with the food.  Most, in fact, almost all proper restaurants will immedialty appologize and take the food abck to the kitchen. Not these fine people, nope, they wanted to argue about it and embarrass me in front of my girlfriend the others dining there.  

they ultimately took the chicken back to the kitchen and asked if I wanted somthing else.  At this point I had somwhat lost my appetite and didnt want to give them any more of my money for being rude to me. I told them I was fine and didnt need anything else, I actaully like generals chicken if it is done properly and that is what I wanted.  When I said that I didn't want anything else, they told me I would have to pay half of the cost for the foul tasting food I had sent back to the kitchen, of which I only had one bite of. 

I asked to speak to the manager.  When the manager came over, I tried to explain to her the situation.  She told me that she tasted my food and it was "fine."  "Must be somthing wriong with you." she said.  I foolishly wanted to try and reason with her forgetting I was not dealing with a rational person who can be reasoned with.  Luckily for me her cell phone rang in the middle of our conversation and rather than ignore it, she answered it.  "You are going to answer your phone??  I said.  "this place is a joke, come on sweetie we are leaving"  we stood up, I threw the money I owded them for my girlfirend's food on the table and walked out.

I spent the rest up the night burping up some kind of foul smell from eiher the bad gyooza's I ate or that nasty chicken. 

I hope the city shuts them down.  It was  a horrible experience for us and it seems many others as well.  I would like to know if there is a way to petition the city to close a restaurant that is obviously creating bad experiances for not only US who live here, but the tourists who help support many who live and work here as well.

thanks for reading, don't go there, unless your worst enemy is treating you to dinner.
author: Frank F.

description:
I say "this is one of the best 'Chinese' restaurants i have ever been to".

Me and  friend's  walked all around Frisco and found that this was the most authentic dinning we had seen. It is decorated in Chinese fashion ,With a up scale setting in the 'dining area' and in no way was disappointing,Loud,or distracting.

We were seated at Tables that had plenty of dining space,White table clothes without stains or spot's, the food came out amazing.
We ordered the Chinatown sampler for three,hot tea and rounds of beer.
The waitress was Cute,very polite, And the service was very quick and in no way did they make us feel rushed to leave (as a matter of fact they let us stay after they were closing to finish our drinks and conversation).

I suggest you give it a try and see for your self . A+
author: brett p.

description: Excellent food, from the hot and sour soup and their dim sum combo all the way through their jasmine tea and green tea ice cream.  We sat on the upstairs patio and the dragons paid our restaurant a visit on their way up the street.  I have NO IDEA what the other yelpers are talking about, is there a doppleganger restaurant here sometimes? Outstanding experience, completely recommend it to any and all consumers of Chinese cuisine!
author: Gary B.

description: BWAHAHAHAHA! A yelp-lapse landed me in this shite hole! Lesson learned.FML.
author: Joseph F.

description:
Ugh, unfortunately like everyone else, my family visiting from out of town and I got lured into this place with a coupon while being too hungry to look for another place. 

It was a really cold day and they sat us by the door where a draft was blowing in. When we asked to be moved, they refused, said "wait a minute" and brought one of their space heaters over to us... -__- 

The food took forever, was medicore (freezer potstickers come on), and the most appalling part was getting charged $5.00 for rice and $3.00 for tea. WTF? So much for the coupon.... 

I'll definitely be telling everyone I know to stay away from this place.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Uhhhhh......just came here with my dad b/c the guy loves coupons. Pushy waitress have made for an unpleasant experience.  Food actually isn't too bad but surprisingly overpriced-although I'm here b/c of a coupon! Discount! 

If you are thinking about visiting this facility I think you'd be better off going to R&G.  I think the plethora of 1 stars is a bit harsh, it's not that bad, and probably an immediate reaction to the terrible service.  If you were in say Stockton, CA & had no other choices then it's not a bad option but you are in the middle of Chinatown!!!! You can do better.
author: Yong K.

description:
I wish I had been able to get a reliable internet connection before checking this place out, it would have saved me the money, time, and cuss words.

I, like many of the unfortunate reviewers, got suckered in by the coupon for free potstickers and 20% off. Kudos for the marketing blitz idea, if only they had a decent product to follow it up with.

Before I unleash the fury that only a text box can deliver, I shall start with the good. The sesame chicken I had was actually pretty good. It was a plate of chicken strips in a sesame type sauce(shocking) that was different from any other take on the dish that I've had but really pretty good. The pot stickers were also different but very good, a nice clear meatiness to them that I had not yet gotten from a potsticker.

Now on to the reason I'll never go back. 

For starters, even before I ordered I had the sneaking suspicion i was about to get screwed over. The entree's were reasonably priced, but the sides and other things that were usually free(rice and such) were over priced. The waitress pushed us to order a ton of extra crap we didn't want to buy(hot tea!).

The meal was delivered in such a weird order that it messed with the whole experience. The first thing the brought out was the "fried rice"(a pathetic smattering of burnt rice and a few refugee looking vegetables). This sat looking lonely on our table for 5 minutes before my friends entree showed up. After him awkwardly pecking at his food, not wanting to be rude, but not wanting to eat cold food for a solid 10 minutes my food finally arrived. I had to ask the waitress if mine was still coming and she gave me this rushed/automated response "yes, it on the way" before flitting off to some other area of the restaurant.

The bill was what really sealed the deal on this place. Our check arrived and there was some weird added things to the bill that we didn't quite understand, so we wasted another 10 minutes trying to catch the attention of the waitress who had taken our order. The total was almost $40 for two 12 dollar entrees. There was a random $9.50 charge we didn't remember ordering. The older lady who took our order explained that it was for the large(a gross exaggeration) plate of fried rice we had ordered. Now the menu I looked at said that a side of rice is 1.50 and a full order is 5.00, now these prices were for steamed rice, assuming this to be the general guidelines I chose fried rice when asked for my preference. Perhaps this was my fault, but it seems that 10 dollars for a small plate of rice of that caliber is outrageous at best.

I suppose this will seem to be the sad ramblings of a tourist who got suckered by shiny things that disguise the true intent, but it still seems that of all things, a decent chinese lunch should be one activity where I shouldn't have to worry about getting screwed over.
author: Braxton E.

description: Great view of chinatown @ balcony @ this restaurant & good lunch
author: Charo S.

description:
Wish we had googled this place before we were lured by their people on the street. We arrived SF at night and stayed in a hotel near Chinatown, so we tried to find a place for a late dinner, and to my surprise few restaurants were still open by 10pm in Chinatown. So we went in there after browsing their menu.
They serve terrible food, in tiny size. Pictures on their menu looks nothing like what we actually had. Those that looked like dishes were served in regular bowls, and the taste... I'm a Chinese and those stuff were among the worst I've ever had.
They will add the tip for you on the bill. Just rude. There were 2 of us and we ended up paying almost $60 for an appetizer and two tiny, greasy main courses. And yes, they charge you for steamed rice.
I googled this place afterwards in both Chinese and English, and looked like this place was already notorious. I had no idea how they can still make it. It seems like they do this trick mostly on naive tourists, especially at nights when most restaurants in Chinatown were closed.
Anyway, stay away from this place! They don't even take the trouble to come up with a better name.
author: Julia S.

description:
Totally should have read the reviews before coming here. I was wandering around Chinatown as part of a group of 8 and we were being pretty indecisive. We happened upon a corner where several ladies were handing out flyers for free potstickers so we figured we'd try it. 
The food was certainly better than one star, but still nothing special. The problem we encountered was that the person at the entrance had sold us on the set dinner (even though our one vegetarian could not eat anything on the set menu), you know the one where you pay 12 or 13 bucks per person and get a set amount of dishes based on the number of people. However, once we were seated and our waitress came she told us that this was only for the lunch special and so we could have the same thing but it would be an extra 2 dollars per person. Since it had taken us so long to even decide on a restaurant and we were already very hungry we just sucked it up but this is totally unacceptable. 
Avoid this restaurant for their shady business practices and because you can find much better food all around it.
author: Phil L.

description: This place makes me sick and the paints are coming off from the wall.  the food tastes awful...no taste at all. Waitress is unfriendly. The prices are way too expensive. Never coming back to this restaurants. The environment looks terrible and no where to move around in tables are too close together. Its hella bad for my taste.
author: Alice C.

description: Zero stars if possible.  Why?  THEY ADD ON THEIR OWN TIP!  The way we found this out was through another customer arguing with the waitress about some mysterious charge.  She said it was the tip, and he was not happy.  When we looked at our bill they added on a 17% tip for only 4 of us -- so not happy.  Bad.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!
author: Vin L.

description:
Eating at the Chinatown Restaurant was the worst dining experience we have ever had in San Francisco. The food was terrible and the service was equally bad. 

When we were led upstairs and saw all the customers were western tourists, we knew something was wrong. I wanted to leave right away; my husband said that if a restaurant could last for 90 years in San Francisco, it could not be too bad. Well, he was wrong. 

First, the service was bad. The waitress (or the manager?) tried to push us for the expensive dishes; when we finished ordering, she kept asking us to order more food. We told her that was enough food for us; she was not happy and showed a very bad attitude the entire time. 

Thank God we did not order more. The food was horrible. We were convinced that the two dim sum dishes were store-bought pre-made frozen food (we are familiar with those.) They weren't even heated properly. The soft shell crab was small, not fresh, no flavor, not hot enough, and very greasy. The steamed sea bass, which she told us it was fresh (my mistake to follow her recommendation), was also flavorless, greasy (yes, a grossly greasy steamed fish) and felt like had been previously frozen. We both felt sick after we ate. 

The tasteless greasy food was not cheap. In addition, they charged $2 for the tea, which was not even a halfway decent tea. It was obvious that they only intend in a "one-time deal", not a repeat visit. They scam you for every penny with extremely poor quality food/service because they know you will never go back. (By the way, we just found out that they added the tip on the bill without telling us, which means we double-tipped a very bad service.)
author: S M.

description:
I was here back in July of 2007 and am only now coming to write a review.  Why? Because it was the absolute WORST dining experience I've ever had and will never forget it.

Yes, I was drawn in by whatever special offer they were handing out at the street corner at the time.  We walked in and upstairs, it was overcrowded so they decided to seat us outside on the tiny balcony, wind and all.  I wondered how we were going to eat at the tiny table, but it was an interesting view, I guess.  We waited out there for what felt like 20 minutes before heading back inside - nobody had come to take our drink orders or give us menus.  Yeah, I love being forgotten about when I'm a paying customer.

Then, instead of being seated immediately and given an apology, we waited for another 20 minutes or more.  People came in after us and were seated promptly, given menus and HAD EVEN ORDERED THEIR FOOD before we were even shown to a table.  There's not even much seating in this place to begin with.  We finally ended up at a table back in the corner with a fan blowing at high speed right next to it.  So our tablecloth was blowing around and being pretty obstructive.  And then, guess what? We waited FOREVER for someone to come take our orders.  wtf.  And of course waited ages for our food to come...  And then there were some wrong charges on our bill.

I don't remember how it tasted or what we ordered.  Vaguely remember it being overly greasy.  It didn't matter and doesn't matter because the only taste left in my mouth was one of horrrribleee service.  It was a ridiculous experience and this place should not be in business.

I don't know why we didn't leave after we'd been left on the balcony for 20 minutes.  I don't know why we didn't leave after we'd been sitting inside waiting for a table for 20+ minutes.  Ugh. 

It's clear this place exists only to take advantage of people.  You'd be better off going to some crummy China Buffet.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Five stars for their marketing strategy. All you suckers should know that any restaurant that solicit on the street corner to get business is pretty close to whoring themselves on the street. Even tourists should do research and find out which restaurants are good in Chinatown. Of course, suckers are everywhere, and that's how this restaurant stays in business. 
This restaurant did not lie about being opened for 90 years. Back in the 60's and 70's, Sun Heung Keung, its original name, was a very good Chinese restaurant. Even in the 90's when Francisco Hsieh, a Chinatown politician, took over and changed the name to Chinatown Restaurant, the food was decent.  However, management has changed over several times. BEWARE - that free pot sticker ain't worth it!
author: susan g.

description:
CONFUCIUS SAYS  "Be weary of  Chinese restaurants where you don't see Chinese people"


... so many things wrong with this place
author: PJ M.

description: Had the dim sum special for $15.95, as it had a little bit of everything. Also had an order of fried rice and green tea.  Food was ok, nothing too exciting, except for the sesame balls which were scrumptious. Service was prompt and very nice.  Overall it was good, probably wouldn't make a special trip here though.
author: Laura W.

description: The Oriental Pearl was busy and I was in a hurry. I was surprised at the bland food at this overpriced place. I thought that since it was Chinatown I could get a decent meal. It was edible. The service was terrible, but it's supposed to be terrible in Chinatown. I go there so I can read a book without being disturbed by waiters or waitresses asking me if I need anything. So I guess I can recommend the service if you are looking for peace and quiet. If you want good food, keep walking.
author: Jon F.

description:
Run, RUN AWAY from this restaurant!!!!

An employee was passing out coupons in front of the restaurant for 20% off. I didn't want to go in there, but my friend was really hungry and insisted, so we went inside. When we ordered, they took the coupon from us. The food was very subpar (not good Chinese food at all, and believe me, I know good Chinese food). We ordered 3 dishes, and when they handed us the bill, it was for $50 even. Wtf? Now how do they figure that?

Suspicious, we examined the bill, and it looked like they only gave us a discount on some of our food, and they automatically gave themselves a generous tip. Ok, I've heard of tips being added on when you're in a party of maybe 6 or more people. But, we were 2 people, for crying out loud!! 

Also, we asked to see the original coupon, but they refused to bring it to us. Could it be that the coupon did not say it could only be used on certain items, like they were claiming?!?

We argued about the bill, and they knocked off a few dollars, but it was still more than we thought it should be. Lame ass restaurant. We will never eat here again.

To make matters worse, my friend got sick from the food. ANOTHER REASON to run from this restaurant!! Yes, he was in the bathroom for quite a while, sitting on the toilet. It sounded so noisy and painful that I wished I could shove something in my ears so I wouldn't hear it. I think I escaped getting sick because I barely touched the food. I would rather be hungry than eat here.

How the h*LL does this place still stay open? They should be shut down from unethical business practices, not to mention unsanitary!

Please, if you know any friends who are visiting San Francisco and will be wandering through Chinatown, tell them in advance to steer cleer of this place!
author: Wendy L.

description:
These people are literally thieves.  I paid my bill for takeout in cash, but was not given my change.  So, I paid $6.00 for barbecue pork buns that would have cost me 70 cents on Clement Street.  I have a high tolerance and even appreciation for cheap Chinese food, but my buns were sickeningly bad.  

While waiting twenty minutes for dim sum overheated in a microwave, I witnessed the staff run out onto the street after a customer and demand a tip.

I agree with previous reviewers.  The place should be closed down.
author: Billy B.

description:
went there for the first time for lunch last week, and i wasn't disappointed.  service was good, and it didn't feel rushed at all.  lunchtime crowd is not too busy at least on that day.

the duck and the walnut shrimp were pretty much as good as you can get anywhere in town.  price was in line with what you would expect in that area.  

had a pretty good dining experience, and i definitely will be going again.
author: Fauz S.

description: This restaurant has been known as "Chinatown Restaurant" in English for the past 20 years.  I'd suggest looking under that label for reviews.
author: GarySoup I.

description: Worst restaurant I've probably eaten at. The Chinese food was average, not bad but not spectacular. However, we literally received the worst service I've ever experienced in my life. We were told they were out of spoons when we asked for a serving spoon to share the fried rice. What kind of restaurant runs out of spoons? We had to ask 3 different people until we could get our glasses refilled with water, and were automatically charged an outrageous tip. Would never eat here again.
author: Alok G.

description:
My sister was lured by the outdoor deck of this dung-hole like a moth to a light. Being that she sees the sun 3x a year in SF made her understandably want to dine outside. 

I will skip the particulars, but the sunny deck was substituted for by an ignored table in the back corner of the restaurant. The sticker shock of the menu was only made more disappointing by the taste of the gruel they served. 

The reason for this post is not to discuss the meal, but to issue a Public Health warning about the varying levels of illness that hit all three of us within the next 8 hours and that lasted for several days.

My wife and I had to return to SD via airplane the next day with an 8 month old in tow. Food poisoned to overcrowded and understaffed Southwest Airlines. 

Worst day of my life, no thanks to this petri-dish of filth restaurant. 
All s*** talking aside, you clowns are charging enough to people for food to keep a kitchen clean and not cross contaminate food. It's not cool.
author: geee d.

description: This place was really, really bad.  Bad food, bad service, way over the top price-lunch for 3 adults $94?? WTH.  When we got there we had to ask 5 times if we could order (after sitting there for 15 minutes waiting), we had ask several times for soy sauce, chili oil, vinegar (that we never got), napkins, water and finally we had ask 4 times to get the check.  Give me a freaking break.  A greasy meal that I had to beg for and pay through the nose. What a rip off this place is I'll never go there again and I would recommend anyone even bother giving it a chance since the restaurant has no redeeming qualities.
author: Wendy S.

description: This restaurant was terrible for the service. We came in a large group with two tables and only one table was served after 45 minutes. The manager was rude and told us that we already had our food. After much arguing and a threat with the manager to call the police we overpaid the bill and left without getting a meal. Worst restaurant experience our group has ever experirnced. Don't go--you'll regret it
author: Gail M.

description:
I was in the area for work and walked in here with a colleague because we didn't have much time.  Seems like a standard Chinese restaurant.  I had to keep flagging the waitress down for water refills, and I ordered a side of rice and had to flag her down because it didn't come with my dish.  She apologized and explained that they were making it, which is why it was taking some time.

Just an okay place, probably won't go back since there are other places to explore in the area.
author: Cathleen T.

description:
RIP OFF!!!!

Like similar reviews- we totally got suckered into the "FREE POTSTICKERS" and "FREE ICECREAM" flier that was being handed out on the street and also the sign that said that dimsum was being served until 10PM (it was about 4PM at the time). We figured "hey why not, let's try something new and different today!)

We got upstairs and it was full of tourists. I already knew that we were going to get ripped off and it was confirmed when I opened up their menu and saw the ridiculous prices. We ordered the regular dishes that we usually would : sui mai, spareribs, chicken feet, bbq pork w/ noodles, green onion pancakes and shanghai dumplings. EVERYTHING WAS NASTY and I am not even joking. This has got to be the worst dimsum place i have ever tried in my life!!! The chicken feet was bland, the spareribs were dry as hell and it tasted more like chicken to me, the sui mais were dry and tasted like sh1t and the pancakes were doughy and dried as well. GROSS

On top of the nasty food, we didnt even get the free potstickers because the server said it came with entrees only- the greentea icecream tasted like crap too! The only thing that tasted good was the fortune cookie- no joke- not even exaggerating!!!

NOTE* I am a San Franciscan so if you rate this place 5 stars, PLEASE message me and I will give you names of other restaurants in the city that has way tastier dimsum. Dont waste your money on this place because you are getting ripped off!
author: M W.

description:
Can I give it NO STARS PLEASE??  The worse place to get trapped in San Francisco!!!  We saved a group of 5 people on our way to avoid making the same mistake that we did.  Coupon is misleading with 20% off entire meal *small letters say entree only*  Guess what?  Fried rice is NOT considered an Entree.  Who would have known?  Dim Sum is no considered an entree!  

1.  Food is way too expensive for the quality and serving size.  Common!  $30.00 for peeking duck dish?  REALLY??  Food was average...edible but nothing that was great...everything was deep fried so very greasy.  Paid 93.00 for 4 adult and 1 child for LUNCH..TOTAL RIP OFF!

2.  Service was disorganized and unattentive.  We were asked by 3 different persons on how many people we had in our party, and our table had no utencils or silverware.  Food came out fairly quickly but no one checked on our table or asked if we needed anything else.

3.  WORSE OFF...the bill had gratuity added already for our party of 4 and a half ON TOP OF TAX & BEVERAGES!!  We spoke to the "manager" and she told us that "if we wanted to tip like that than she would change it."  NO ONE TIPS ON TOP OF TAX!!! 

NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER AGAIN!!  Tourist trap indeed!! We will be reporting them to the BBB!!!
author: L N.

description:
This place is a trap. I couldn't agree more with everyone's reviews.

My husband and I went in yesterday since I was craving for some dimsum. There are Chinese girls who are luring people with coupons and the place seemed nice so we decided to give it a try.

First of all, there was no host to seat you, and then when you've finally found yourselves a table(like after 15 min or so), no one's there to take your orders. Somebody came like after 10 mins and took our orders. My husband and I didn't order much since we just wanted some dimsum for a light afternoon snack. The order taker seemed disgusted that we ordered 3 kinds of dimsum only. After 15 minutes of another waiting for food, my husband kindly asked the server for something but he was totally ignored by the Lady! She was outright rude!!! and we were just trying to be patient with them since we've waited so long. In short, we left without paying for the tasteless potstickers and tried to warn other guests to come in.

I agree that this place should be shut down. Downright BAD BAD BAD SERVICE!!! If I can rate this with 0 stars, I would.
author: Leah H.

description:
WORST PLACE EVER!!!!!!! DO NOT GO HERE!

My husband and I went because they passed out coupons and said "free parking!" and so we parked in the garage it mentioned on the flier and brought our ticket in when we went to eat. It said "2 hours free parking" and that was it. No mention of how much you had to spend or anything. 

So we told the waitress (who was totally out of it and extremely rude and ignored us half the time we tried to get her attention) that we had the parking ticket and the coupon, as well. She was totally emotionless. She took our order and walked away as we hollered "oh can we also get more water?....ma'am? wait!" and she could definitely hear us, just flat out ignored us. And after bringing out our food, like 20 min later - which was greasy and gross, the only thing we liked was the fried rice - she still hadn't filled our waters. 

When she brought the bill, we even thought about not tipping, but we've both been servers before and thought she might be having a bad day. We went inside to leave and asked if she could stamp our parking garage ticket for the free parking and she said "I sowy, you mus spend minimum 35 dolla!" and we were like "what?? I doesn't say that on the coupon or to-go menu we have" and she said "i sowy, no parking for you!" and walked away.

A table close by offered to have it stamped under their bill since it was over 35 dollars and they didn't have a ticket of their own. They were staying anyway to use the "free" wi-fi and so when the server claimed that the manager was in the bathroom (FOR 45 MIN!!!) we decided to wait since the people at the table didn't care. That was the dumbest decision, but we just wanted to talk to the manager about it. 

She finally came up and was SO RUDE I COULD NOT BELIEVE IT! She SCREAMED AT MY HUSBAND AND CALLED HIM A "LIAR"  and was making such a huge scene that someone even started to record it. WORST SERVICE EVER! We had never been treated like that before and were so offended. 

DO NOT GO HERE! Their food cleanliness rating was only an 86, too, that had just recently gone up from a 76 because THEY KEEP CLEAN UTENSILS NEXT TO RAW FOOD AND TRASH! GROSS!!!!!!!!
author: Kaelin W.

description: Don't get suckered in by the free potsticker flyers or the fact that it smells good when you walk in becasue that's all this place has going for it.  This was also restaraunt number 2 that my friend and I had attempted and we had fled the previous one due to foul odors.  Service was atrocious.  My friend and I were waiting there for oh around 10 minutes.  She even gave the eye to one of the waitresses to no avail. We looked at each other and at the depressed tourists that were stuck there waiting for bills and legged it. The smell was a cover for bad service.  If I could give a zero I would.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I went here because two ladies assaulted me with coupons on Grant St.; free potstickers and 20% off an entree.  
The hot and sour soup was among the best I've had - the $8.00 family bowl easily feeds 3 people, possibly 4.  We had General Tso's Chicken and the shrimp in creamy sweet sauce with candied walnuts.  Both were very good, the breading like tempura:  light and crispy, not soggy in spite of the sauces.
The downside to this place:  the service.  We had six different people waiting on us, so it wasn't that bad, but many people at tables around us got up and left.  They were telling everyone that food will take 30 minutes, blaming the delay on the holidays.  
Prices weren't horrible; not the cheapest, but I've paid as much for worse.
Oh yeah...two of the servers were screechers, yelling at their co-workers in Chinese in a shrill tone that peeled the paint from the walls.
author: Steve S.

description:
Word of advice: don't eat in a Chinese restaurant filled with nothing but white patrons.

Chinatown restaurant is a horrible tourist trap. The "discount" flyiers they hand out on the street are for 20% off meals that are priced 50% too high in the first place.

The service is horrible, and sneaky to boot--bringing a $2 bottle of water when we asked for a glass of tap water, then not taking the discount off our meal and hoping we didn't notice.

Stay away.
author: Ziad E.

description: We had dim sum here last night. I love chinese food, but this was very average quality. I won't be going back. I'm sure there are better places in Chinatown!
author: Jonathan V.

description: Simply one of the worst restaurants I've ever been to. I put this place up there with Green Papaya. Awful service, awful prices, awful food. This place gives the city a bad name and fools people with their coupons. There are other places that are 100x better so save your money.
author: Shawn P.

description:
Summary: Tourist trap, horrible food, even more poor service and false advertising for specials.

We went in for lunch on 8/31/2008.  The place we had yelped was closed, and we had received a flyer for free potstickers and green tea ice cream.  We went in and I ordered 4 different Dim Sum dishes for about $20 (very expensive) and my wife ordered a dish of noodles.  When I tried to redeem the coupon I was told that the noodles were not considered an entree and neither were my Dim Sum dishes.  Even though the total cost of my Dim Sum was more than their average entree dish price; they would not give me the free potstickers.

When I finally did receive my Dim Sum it was horrible.  The pork buns were stale and the siu mai was just salt on top of salt.  They never came back to check on us and we had to flag different people down to get us fresh water.  My wife ordered a sprite which was horrible, it tasted like seltzer water (probably the end of the fountain can).  Furthermore, her noodles took over 30 minutes and when we inquired about them, they came out 1 minute later and were cold.  Which means that they probably were just sitting on the counter and forgotten.  We later found out that our waitress had been reassigned to handing out flyers, but it appeared another waitress was not assigned to our table.

I was able to save two lucky souls who entered the restaurant and I walked over to them and told them not to waste their time.  They thanked me, promptly got up, and left.

Let me reiterate: Stay Away, Stay Away, Stay Far Far Away.  I wish I could give 0 stars.
author: Carlo B.

description:
warning: EXTREMELY biased review coming up.

I REALLY wanted dim sum (pork buns mostly). past 9 pm. We walked up and down jackson and washington, walking into places and seeing if they had anything. a bakery down the street had sesame balls and plain buns, but that just didn't fullfill my needs. I NEEDED steamed pork buns!! Than we stumbled upon this place. late night dim sum! hell to the yeah!!
We ordered four orders of pork buns. and they were GOOD.
so 5 stars based on pork buns. and the fact they are open late and have dim sum AT ALL HOURS! :)
author: Lexie L.

description:
I had a fairly good experience here, so I was surprised to see that almost all the rest of the reviews were awful!  I went here on a whim, I had parked my car in the lot for the weekend and was waiting for someone, and this place was right there.  It was not too crowded, which might explain why I received much better service than most.

The dim sum menu was small, but that was ok since I am not really an expert on dim.  I ordered a steamed pork dumpling, shrimp dumpling, and sesame bun and my girlfriend ordered the mongolian beef.  I thought the shrimp dumpling and sesame buns were good, but the steamed pork dumpling was nothing special.  I didn't really think the mongolian beef was all that good, but my girlfriend liked it.

They also brought a free dumpling dish on the house which was good (I'm not sure what it was, it seemed similar to gyoza), and gave us both  free green tea ice cream when they brought the check!  They were very friendly and allowed my girlfriend to charge her phone while we ate.  They also allowed us to use the bathroom later in the day when we were nearby.

I would have given this place a 3 just for the food.  I thought it was pretty good, although nothing special and a little pricey.  But I bumped them up to a 4 star for the great service!
author: Stephen D.

description:
I really should have reviewed this place about 5 weeks ago when I went with a friend, but I was probably too frustrated to bring myself to think about it.  (Okay, I just hadn't bothered til now.)

At any rate, this place was bad.  Any place that has people out front shoving their menus on you is probably not good.  If they need to attack pedestrians just to get patrons, stay clear.  It was a few hours after my friend go in from Chicago and she wanted some crab rangoon.  It was on their menu and we were told we got free potstickers and 20% off something so we went in.

There was one other group eating - about 3 people.  Yet another sign.  

We ordered an appetizer of spring rolls, she got crab rangoon, a side of rice, the potstickers, and I got some tofu veggie medley.

A recap: potstickers were quite subpar, the springrolls didn't show up until after the entrees, my tofu entree was originally served as chicken,  when i got the spring rolls they were really oily, the side of rice came wrapped in some kind of leaf and had pork in it, and we didn't get our 20% discount for the entrees.  Their apology for their meaty snafu came in the form of a free bottle of water (which I never requested).  It was much more expensive than it should have been, too.  Our bill was over $50.  I had to ask him about our discount and I received it as some cash from the register.

Bad food, bad service, bad price.  Just bad.
author: Lindsay D.

description: Service is absolutely awful-we had straws, plates and sauce thrown on the table and we hadn't even eaten yet. Entree came out and then we waited for the rice for a while... Food was pricey and less than mediocre (its china town-we expected it). Would not come again and never recommend.
author: J J.

description: Don't eat here. The food is alright but not worth the price! The Mongolian beef wasn't spicy and was twice the price for half the serving. I would recommend a whole in the wall Mom and Pop versus this this place. The worst part is $82.00 later my husband and I are still hungry
author: Lelani R.

description: Overpriced, Horrible service, and they got our orders wrong, along with the table next to us. Don't waste your time. The food quality cannot justify the high price.
author: Matt F.

description: Very clean, quiet, food was wonderful. Had the snow peas and broccoli which was different but so flavorful. Potstickers were great and the chefs fried rice. Green tea ice cream was a nice ending.  I recommend.
author: julie m.

description:
I AM SO YELPING A RESTAURANT BEFORE STEPPING INTO ONE FROM HERE ON OUT!!!! OMG!!! As I'm about to write about my mayhem just this evening at this so called "Chinatown Restaurant", reading everything NEGATIVE is so true; what a disgrace and bad bad bad reputation for your representation of true authentic Szechuan Chinese food, shame on you! I'm Chinese and in food business and am horribly mortified and embarrassed by you!

I got suckered in by the girls passing out flyers, yes, didn't pay much attention becuz I'm with my love strolling and saw the false advertisment from the flyer!!!! Food tasted and looked NOTHING like the flyer!!!!! I'm usually a dedicated yelper before taking my hubby to any restaurants, but this time, we figure we're just getting a quick app and be off strolling again, bad mistake!!! 

All the negs about the House Witch are absolutely true. We asked in fluent Chinese if the "Water soup fish bowl" is a soup, she replied "Yes" and she scurried away with our order. Low and behold, the "soup" came to our table in GREASY HOT CHILI OIL FISH BOWL!!!! So we asked the kind waitress if that was a mistake, and she shyly replied, "let me get The Boss". At that point, I sensed her fearfulness and mistreatment from the House Witch. Poor wait staff for having to put up with her to make a living at this difficult time.
